What I learned from observing more than 150+ front end job offers, that HTML, CSS , and JS only will not get you a job.

Last two days I worked on a simple project, to practice the technologies that I learned recently, which are #tailwindcss and #vite combined with vanilla JS. I learned a lot from this project and will share them in another posts.Here are the highlights:1) Tailwind is very fast in development, but every one needs time to adapt to the syntax, which is very similar to CSS.2) How to customize breakpoints.3) use Google fonts with Tailwind.4) setup vite.5) changing images dynamically.6) I googled a lot That I forgot to use flex-box to align and justifying my headings üòÇ.

Continuous learning and the pursuit of lifting up my life and job quality is a core concept for me that I am trying to fulfill every single day.After learning the fundamentals of CSS and HTML from multiple resources like freeCodeCamp, W3schools, YouTube and reading a couple of books.I moved toward JS and after finishing the course on Udemy with this great instructor ‚ÄúJonas Schmedtmann‚Äù I wanted to get his course of HTML and CSS to get a deeper understanding of these languages.And the course fulfilled my expectations.I‚Äôm more confident than ever was using them and deploying my knowledge.I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôve obtained a new certification: Build Responsive Real-World Websites with HTML and CSS from Udemy!

I‚Äôm so happy to do the first step of making one of my dreams come true.I always wanted to have my own website.To reflect my skills and make it easier for people to find me.So yes I Finally bought that domain name I wanted üéâ.and started designing it üòä.

There isn't much to show you guys about today's project, it was about working with arrays method such as filter, reduce and map.I learned that when working with objects to pay attention to when using a bracket or dot notations to access their properties.When you loop over an object you must use the bracket notation. and the reason for that is that bracket notation accepts variables. On the other hand, dot notation uses the exact property name.and when we loop over something we usually manipulate or create variables.will write another post about the reduce method. #javascript

Mental health apps are the new self-help books.Self-help books are great; they're a way to learn about yourself and improve your life. But sometimes, you don't want to read a book. Sometimes, you just want to get something done and that's where mental health apps come in.Apps like Calm, Headspace, and Happify are great for getting help when you're on the go. They may give you a quick positive boost or calm your nerves down if you feel stressed. These apps have different features and personalities, so it's very important to try them out and find which one works best for you!And which mental health solutions have you tried before and which features do you like the most when using them?#mentalhealth #mentalhealthapp #calm #headspace #happify

Virtual and augmented reality are two of the most exciting technologies coming up. This is why it is not surprising that they are increasingly being used in education on a daily basis.But the surprising thing is how they can improve learning and engagement, especially for students who may not be as engaged in traditional teaching techniques.Virtual Reality in EducationVR is already being used to help students learn about subjects like anatomy and history by immersing them in a virtual world where they can explore a museum or walk through ancient Rome. They've also been used to help kids with autism improve their social skills by giving them an opportunity to interact with other people through avatars.Augmented Reality in EducationThe AR was used to make the classroom experience more appealing to students by embedding virtual objects in their actual classroom environment. For example, teachers could use AR to show students how to build a car engine or explain how an animal lives by creating a virtual zoo with animals that appear right before their eyes.And what do you think about that approach in the educational system?#VR #AR #edtech #elearning #learning #engagement #teaching

Who's excited about Microsoft 365 Copilot?Microsoft has just released a new product that promises to take your office productivity to the next level.What is Microsoft 365 Copilot? It's a platform that helps you manage your employees' calendars, schedules, and tasks. The platform also allows you to send reminders and even set up alerts when deadlines are approaching.The major benefits of Microsoft 365 Copilot are described as follows:- Unleashes creativity: Copilot generates a first draft to edit and iterate on in Word, helps create beautiful presentations in PowerPoint, and analyzes trends, and creates professional-looking data visualizations in Excel.- Unlocks productivity: Copilot helps to clear your inbox in minutes with suggested replies in Outlook and summarizes key discussion points in Teams during a meeting. It can also automate repetitive tasks, create chatbots and go from idea to working app in minutes.- Uplevels skills: Copilot unlocks all the rich functionality across Microsoft 365 using just natural language and makes people better at what they are good at and helps to quickly master what they've yet to learn.You can visit Microsoft's official website to find out more details about it:https://lnkd.in/eiP7fjCU#microsoft #productivity #creativity #microsoft365copilot https://lnkd.in/eFpD-aB6

üéÆGamification is being used in üìóeducation to make learning more engaging and fun.In the classroom, gamification can help students learn about topics that may not necessarily be their favorite. By making lessons more fun and engaging, students will be more likely to want to learn about these topics.‚úîÔ∏èOne example of gamification in education is the use of badges. Badges are a great way for students to earn rewards for completing tasks or learning new information. For example, if a student gets an ‚ÄúA‚Äù on their test, they might get a badge that says ‚Äúawesome!‚Äù‚úîÔ∏èAnother great example of gamification is the use of quests. Quests give students tasks that they must complete in order to move forward in the game. For example, if a student wants to earn a certain number of points by completing certain assignments, then they can do so by completing quests such as reading books or watching videos online.What type of gamification do you prefer the most‚ùì Do you enjoy earning badges for completing tasks or do you prefer completing quests to earn points? Share your thoughts in comments :)#elearning #gamification #studying #edtech #bdbuzz #education

The future of the financial industry is mobile payments.The ability to pay for things with a tap or a swipe of your phone is quickly becoming the norm, and it's changing the way we think about money. Mobile payments are convenient, easy to use and fast and they're making it easier than ever for people to do things like pay their rent or buy groceries.As more and more people start using mobile payments, it's becoming clear that this is where we're headed: away from cash and checks, toward digital wallets and card readers. I'm sure that this has a great impact on the financial industry and hope to see new and more digitalized approaches. And what do you think about that?#mobilepayments #digitalwallets #fintech #digitalpayments #mobilebanking #paymentsolutions #digitalcurrency #finance

Looking back on time living in Kharkiv, I appreciate the peacefulness and beauty of life in that city before the full-scale invasion. The streets were bustling with friendly locals, the architecture was stunning, and the air was filled with a sense of hope and potential. When I look at this photo, it reminds me of that time.I remember walking through Shevchenko and Central Park, watching families enjoy picnics and children playing, while the sounds of music and laughter filled the air. I also recall the vibrant nightlife, with cafes and bars filled with locals enjoying good company and delicious food.Of course, life was not without its challenges, but all Ukrainians always seemed to have resilience and determination to make the best of any situation. It's heartbreaking to see the city now, torn apart by war.But I hold onto the memories of the peaceful and vibrant Kharkiv that I knew, and I hope for a future where the city can once again thrive and be a place of joy and prosperity for its people. #kharkiv #peacefulmemories

Virtual reality is transforming the real estate industry, and it's not just for fun.Virtual reality is already being used to help potential buyers of apartments and houses get a better sense of what their space will look like once they move in. With virtual reality, you can stand in your new living room before you buy it, so you don't have to worry about whether or not it will fit your couch or if the color scheme will clash with your furniture.It's also great for showing off properties to prospective clients. You can show them a property in its entirety without having to travel miles away from home or through traffic jams. This can help you stand out from competitors who aren't offering this service yet!If you're looking for ways to make your business more efficient and effective, send me a DM!#realestate #proptech #vr ##dreamhome #investmentproperty #homebuying #mortgagebroking #property

Japan is working on developing a special technology that allows homes to rise above ground enough to protect the home in case of earthquakes!This new technology would allow homes to rise above ground enough so that they can be protected from earthquake damage. It would also allow these homes to be built without having to build underground shelters, which is one of the factors that makes building homes in Japan so expensive. This is an exciting new development for Japan and could help make living there more affordable and accessible for many people.#earthquakes #earthquakeengineering #realestate #japan

Wearables and IoT devices are changing the way we monitor our health, and it couldn't come at a better time.The World Health Organization estimates that non-communicable diseases are responsible for 63% of deaths worldwide. This includes chronic conditions like heart disease, stroke, diabetes, and cancer - all of which can be tracked with wearable devices and IoT tools.Wearables have already been used to successfully track patients with Type 1 diabetes, enabling them to make adjustments to their insulin doses in real time. These devices can also help prevent kidney failure in people with Type 2 diabetes by tracking their blood sugar levels.Similarly, IoT devices can be used to monitor heart rate and sleep patterns for individuals who suffer from sleep apnea or irregular heart rhythms. They can also be used as a tool for improving patient outcomes after surgery; for example, by monitoring patients' vitals before surgery so doctors know what to expect once they wake up from anesthesia.IoT devices have the potential to make a huge impact on #healthcare. However, there are some challenges associated with their use in this sector. The first is privacy concerns: many people are hesitant about sharing their personal #data with others and may be hesitant to use #IoT devices if they feel that doing so will compromise their privacy. Another challenge is the lack of interoperability between different devices. No single company currently manufactures all of the different kinds of IoT devices needed by doctors and patients alike.And what do you think about that?

Mental health is important. It's not just a buzzword, it's how you feel about yourself and your life, and the way you deal with stress. And it's something that we should all be thinking about.The truth is, many people are struggling with mental health issues right now - and it's not their fault.The pressures of work and school, combined with financial stresses and family problems are leading to an epidemic of depression and anxiety. Millions of people are suffering from these disorders without getting the help they need. But there are solutions! Here are some ways to cope:- Get outside every day, even if it's only for 5 minutes.- Have a "happy hour" each night where you turn off all electronics and spend time with friends or family.- Practice mindfulness meditation or yoga daily (these activities will also lower stress hormones).- Spend time doing something that makes you happy: playing music, cooking dinner for friends or family, reading a book - whatever brings joy into your life!- Get enough sleep! The National Sleep Foundation recommends 7-9 hours of sleep for adults, but some people need more or less than that. If you're having trouble falling asleep, try to avoid watching TV or using your phone in bed at night because they can stimulate brain activity.Some digital solutions can also help you improve your mental health, which is a totally new approach to deal with that problem. Have you used any of them for such purposes?#mentalhealthawareness #mentalhealthmatters #mentalwellness #mentalhealthrecovery #stressmanagement #mindfulness #healthcare

The COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated the adoption of telemedicine in the healthcare industry. As we continue to navigate through the #pandemic, it's become increasingly clear that telemedicine is not just a temporary solution but a vital component of modern healthcare.Telemedicine platforms offer many benefits for patients, providers, and the healthcare industry in general: it provides a convenient way to receive medical care - especially for those who may not have easy access to physical offices or are at high risk of infection. For healthcare providers, telemedicine provides a way to reach more patients, reduce costs, and streamline processes. Telemedicine has proven to be effective in delivering care for a wide range of medical conditions, including chronic diseases, mental health, and preventive care. It's also demonstrated the potential to improve patient outcomes and reduce healthcare costs.As the post-pandemic world continues to spread, telemedicine will remain a critical aspect of modern healthcare. It's quite important for healthcare providers to embrace telemedicine and incorporate it into their practice, as well as for patients to take advantage of this modern and convenient way to access medical care.If you're a healthcare provider, I encourage you to consider incorporating telemedicine into your practice. And if you've already started doing so, please share your thoughts or challenges that you face while implementing this solution to your business.#telemedicine #healthcare #mentalhealth #covid #medicalcare #digitalization #ehrsoftware

Make the most of your working time with these tips.There are many different ways you can optimize your productivity in the workplace, but here are some of the most effective from my point of view:1. Simulation software can help you streamline your businessIt's no secret that simulation software can help you make better decisions about your company's future. But did you know that this may also help you streamline your existing operations? It's true! You can use simulation software to simulate various scenarios for your current business practices and see how different variables affect each other, then use this information to optimize your workflow.The best part? Unlike other types of systems that require extensive training in order to use them properly, simulation software is easy to learn and use. You don't need an expert team on hand - only one person who knows how to use the software will be able to start right away!Simulation software can be used in a variety of industries. Manufacturing companies can use it to test new products and processes before they're implemented on an industrial scale, while healthcare providers can use it to simulate various scenarios for their patients' care. It's also useful for financial institutions who want to understand how different investments will affect their bottom line.If you would like to check more about that topic, we prepared an article with a comprehensive guide to using that approach in different industries. Can anyone work in sales? I saw a question poll at The Daily Sales about that and decided to provide my own point of view on that.I think people misunderstand what a sales career looks like, and it's not just about closing deals. Selling is about helping people find solutions to their problems, and that's something everybody has to do on a daily basis. Sales is about understanding the needs of your customers and helping them find solutions. It's about building trust and relationships with people so that they know who to turn to when they need help. And it's about being able to clearly communicate your point of view, whether you're speaking individually or presenting to a group. If you have those skills, then you can certainly be a salesman.It's true that a lot of salespeople are extroverts who love networking and meeting new people. But the fact remains that there are many introverted salespeople who understand what their customers need, and can therefore be just as successful as extroverts.The key is to find your niche. You don't need to be the kind of salesperson who loves going out and meeting new people every day. There are other ways to succeed in sales, like working remotely or becoming an expert at a particular product line. So it depends only on your choice what path would you like to choose.#sales #dailysales #career #saleseffectiveness #work #networking #salespeople

Google Maps has added a new feature called #ImmersiveView to its mapping app. The feature allows users to view street-level images of specific locations in five cities: London, Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, and Tokyo. The service will be rolled out to other cities in the future.Immersive View allows users to browse 360-degree imagery at a specific location by clicking on an icon on Google Maps. Users can switch between standard 2D and 3D views using the same icon.The new feature is aimed at making it easier for users unfamiliar with a city to get around on foot or by public transportation by helping them orient themselves before heading out into the streets.Will you try to use it?#googlemaps # #google #future #london #3dviews #innovations #Android #iOS

Ever since full-time remote work started, it's hard to keep up with my full-time job, my consulting business, and my daily tasks at home. Producing lots of work and increasing the quality of that work is difficult to accomplish when you are disorganized and can‚Äôt keep track of what is next. Gladly, I've started using productivity tools to manage my time.1) Google CalendarEvery other Sunday, I come up with a plan for the next two weeks, and things I'd like to get done. I write these up and add them to my calendar to book the slots. If some things I am doing with someone else, I send them a calendar invite, so I exactly know how much time we will spend on a certain task, so we can all respect each other's time. Playing sports, grocery shopping, meeting with the engineers, coffee chat with friends, work duties, family time, etc. - It's all documented in Google Calendar and it can't be changed.Bonus point if all your calendars are synced in order to avoid meeting conflicts. #GoogleCalendar2) Notion All Apple devices come standard with the Notes App (pretty sure Android has its own one). But I migrated to Notion a little less than a year ago. As a very curious person, I just love discovering new things and researching certain topics. This means writing down loads of thoughts. I do a brain dump in Notion as soon as come up with something. On Sundays, I check my notes carefully, sort them out, and put them into my to-do list. Also, Notion gives you an option to save and organize, links, add meeting notes, keep up with teamwork and run your to-do tasks. Check it out, you won't regret it. #Notion3) GrammarlyIn the remote world, you are writing a lot: endless messengers, Slack channels, paperwork you have to deal with it, communicating with the outside world. When you‚Äôre communicating in a language that isn‚Äôt your native tongue, Grammarly helps me to correct my mistakes. I'm a huge fan of Grammarly and have been their customer forever. I feel extra frustrating when my ideas don‚Äôt come across as naturally as in your primary language and you‚Äôre not quite sure if your grammar and wording are correct. Grammarly‚Äôs writing suggestions can help.I've installed Grammarly as Chrome Extension on both work and personal computers. You will get more with paid-version, but free-version is also doing its job quite well. #GrammarlyFinal thought:If your life feels disorganized, try removing your bad productivity habits first and then experimenting with the productivity tools I am using.With the right productivity tools, you can produce the best work of your life and smile at what you have achieved. Have a productive week!

üåü 20 LeetCode Coding Patterns to Follow in MAANG üåüHere's a sneak peek of the 20 LeetCode Coding Patterns you should follow in "MAANG" (which stands for "Mandatory Algorithms for the Next Generation"):1Ô∏è‚É£ Sliding Window2Ô∏è‚É£ Two Pointers3Ô∏è‚É£ Binary Search4Ô∏è‚É£ Fast and Slow Pointers5Ô∏è‚É£ Merge Intervals6Ô∏è‚É£ Top K Elements7Ô∏è‚É£ K-way Merge8Ô∏è‚É£ Breadth-First Search (BFS)9Ô∏è‚É£ Depth-First Search (DFS)üîü Backtracking1Ô∏è‚É£1Ô∏è‚É£ Dynamic Programming (DP)1Ô∏è‚É£2Ô∏è‚É£ Kadane's Algorithm1Ô∏è‚É£3Ô∏è‚É£ Knapsack Problem1Ô∏è‚É£4Ô∏è‚É£ Tree Depth-First Search1Ô∏è‚É£5Ô∏è‚É£ Tree Breadth-First Search1Ô∏è‚É£6Ô∏è‚É£ Topological Sort1Ô∏è‚É£7Ô∏è‚É£ Trie1Ô∏è‚É£8Ô∏è‚É£ Graph - Bipartite Check1Ô∏è‚É£9Ô∏è‚É£ Bitwise XOR2Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£ Sliding Window - OptimalMastering these patterns will give you a solid foundation to tackle a wide variety of coding problems, ranging from arrays and strings to graphs and trees.By internalizing these patterns, you'll become more efficient at solving LeetCode problems and increase your chances of acing coding interviews.Credits:¬†Design Gurus¬†&¬†Arslan Ahmad#CodingPatterns¬†#LeetCode¬†#Maang¬†#CodingCommunity¬†#ProblemSolving¬†#InterviewPreparation LinkedIn Learning

Imagine you want to ask your friend for a cookie. You could just say, "Hey, can I have a cookie?" But if you want to be more specific, you could say, "Hey, can I have a chocolate chip cookie?"API styles are like that. They're a way of asking for information from a computer. But instead of saying "Hey, can I have a chocolate chip cookie?", you say "GET /cookies/chocolate-chip".An API style is like a secret handshake ü§ù between two computers, helping them share and understand each other's messages.There are different styles of handshakes, and each has its own way of sending and receiving information! üåüüó£Ô∏èI've simplified and decoded the secrets of 6 most important API styles for you, so you can save time and focus on what matters most! üöÄüéØùó¶ùó¢ùóîùó£:‚Ä¢ A protocol using XML-based messages for communication‚Ä¢ Requires strict adherence to predefined contracts‚Ä¢ Operates primarily over HTTP or HTTPS‚Ä¢ Commonly used in enterprise environmentsùó•ùóòùó¶ùóß ùóîùó£ùóú:‚Ä¢ An architectural style focused on resources and statelessness‚Ä¢ Employs standard HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)‚Ä¢ Easier to implement and understand compared to SOAP‚Ä¢ Can work with various data formats, but JSON is most commonùó¥ùó•ùó£ùóñ:‚Ä¢ Focuses on remote procedure calls (RPCs) between services‚Ä¢ Uses HTTP/2 for transport and Protocol Buffers for serialization‚Ä¢ Ideal for microservices, where low latency and high efficiency are crucial‚Ä¢ Automatically generates client and server code for multiple languages¬†¬†ùóöùóøùóÆùóΩùóµùó§ùóü:‚Ä¢ A query language and runtime for APIs‚Ä¢ Allows clients to request specific data, reducing over-fetching‚Ä¢ Can combine multiple data sources in a single request‚Ä¢ Developed and open-sourced by Facebookùó™ùó≤ùóØùòÄùóºùó∞ùó∏ùó≤ùòÅ:‚Ä¢ A bidirectional, real-time communication protocol‚Ä¢ Maintains a single, long-lived connection over TCP‚Ä¢ Suitable for web applications requiring live updates‚Ä¢ Not tied to any specific serialization format¬†¬†ùó™ùó≤ùóØùóµùóºùóºùó∏:‚Ä¢ A server-side, event-driven mechanism‚Ä¢ Sends HTTP callbacks (usually POST requests) to specified URLs‚Ä¢ Triggered by specific events or actions within an application‚Ä¢ Useful for integrating third-party services or updating data in real timeWhich one of these styles do you think is the coolest? Comment below!üëáDon't forget to ùóüùó∂ùó∏ùó≤, ùó¶ùóµùóÆùóøùó≤, and ùóßùóÆùó¥ your friends to spread the tech love!üíôüåü Enjoying my content? Stay in the loop! üåü---------Credits: Brij kishore Pandey #api #apitesting #softwareengineering

If you are going to build a robot, then the best choice for today is a BLDC drive with Hall sensors. Make 1000 turns in different directions, at a speed of ~7000 rpm and return to the same point with a good torque! It's like stepper motors, but charged with coffee.The only thing you need for this performance is a good HW driver and reliable firmware for it.#bldcmotor #bldc #MCU #STM32 #engineering #robotics

Another HW part for my new amazing project. And it's not an IoT :)Universal DC or BLDC motor driver board with self diagnostic functions and increased reliability. The biggest advantage of this design is a schematic for low price and in-stock only components.  This driver also has a CAN/RS485 and special M-LINK and P-LINK interfaces. Based on GD32 (STM32) mcu.#bldc #motor #PCB #project #design

What could be worse than a design error?¬†Only if the manufacturer says that this is not a bug, but a feature! And does not focus on it in the documentation.A little tip for those who work with ESP32-WROVER-I (ESP + internal PSRAM) and Ethernet PHY.If you are working with LAN PHY clocking from GPIO0 (clock out mode), then be aware, because the clocking signal needs to be inverted! Be ready to add an inverter or a signal delay circuit (this will be a logic gate/inverter). The manufacturer indicated that this signal has a 180 degree shift for the purpose of supporting the signal delay situation in the line. I do not know how much it is possible to violate the PCB signal integrity rules in order to shift the signal by 180 degrees at a frequency of 50 MHz.For those who do not know - the usual propagation delay is ~ 1ns per 20cm on the PCB board. You can calculate the length by 10 ns yourself. What is the lesson here - always check not only the datasheet.I highly recommend this document: https://lnkd.in/dv-h4Nhd#ESP32 #ESP32WROVER #feature #PCB #signalintegrity

Do you know what we will have in the future as an one IoT standard for #SmartHome devices ?The ansver - I don't know :)But these guys say that it will be a #matter https://lnkd.in/g5khehBTIf you don't know - Matter it's a rebirth of ZigBee, with wired Ethernet version and some Thread's parts. Managed with #Amazon, #Apple, #Google and¬†Zigbee Alliance.One standard - it's good. But pay 20k$ per year for making a device and perform certification - it's a bad idea. Pretty similar for a Z-Wave history and Apple Homekit.Another bad idea is to bring a lot of new devices into 2.4GHz baseband. Everything has a limit in a real world.But if you are ready for it and have a ESP32 - here isESP32 git https://lnkd.in/gJJ9BYfB#iot #future

Prototyping is one of the important areas in product development. Basically, because only when you hold it in your hands, you begin to understand the real value of your product. One example is this position sensor.After the first stage of prototyping, it turned out that the main value is the ease of installing the sensor. The second prototype was made on the basis of a board that I had for my smart home control system project. The same sensor, only wireless. Smaller and better than a RS485 version.#development #sensor #IoT

A little story about the IoT architecture. Almost 1 year ago, I took part in the development of the architecture of an IoT solution for data collection. Among the options was AWS IoT, Google Cloud IoT and creating your own server. After arguing with the developers, I was able to convince them to make their own server. It wasn't easy.And now, a year later, I can finally say that the decision was correct. Why? Well, Google IoT is closing this service. https://lnkd.in/dXuzjWP8Now imagine how much it would cost to transfer released devices to another server.The message of this post is simple - stay independent.#aws #google #iot #mqtt #architecture #cloud

One day a man asked me: What does it take to become a good engineer?I replied: When I have done something, I ask myself if it's good enough. If it's not, then I do it better.Now this project is good enough. It has almost everything ‚Äì electronics, optics, lasers, ISM radio, double server backup (online and offline mode), backend with data integration, mechanical design. So, this is probably the most voluminous EIoT project that I have had recently. I helped the customer obtain a patent for a measuring optical system, which was developed by me. In additional, I also designed and assembled a demo suitcase for demonstration to corporate clients and test production equipment. The project cycle lasted almost a year. Almost half of this period was spent on testing. EIoT is different than regular IoT project in that.As a result, the customer has a scalable system with a low cost of devices, capable of operating without maintenance for more than 3 years.Don‚Äôt stop at the ‚Äúenough‚Äù stage, make it ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù.¬†#iot #EIoT #design #electronics

In the IoT area, it is often necessary to program many MCU chips with different unique IDs in memory. This allows you to distinguish between released devices and track their lifecycle.I have developed software that will help simplify this process if you are working with AVR MCUs and AVR ISP mkII programmer tool.You can download it here:https://lnkd.in/dNpcSq_CI have developed similar software with Delphi before, which required ~800-1200 lines of code.But today I used Python and PyQt5 for this. And now it's only 142 !!! lines for UI, SQLite DB, hex editing, CMD programming and even exporting data.If you haven't used Python for embedded development utilities yet, I recommend taking a closer look at it. A lot of implemented libraries (such as Intel Hex, AES, etc) makes development simple and fast. #iot #Python #Embedded #Microchip #AVR #QT

Finally finished! IoT gate for special sensors in buildings. The schematic/routing took almost 5 days.This device has everything that was required: RF 433 MHz, fully isolated RS485, Ethernet, relay, main and backup power input, integrated backup battery charger with monitoring, RTC, 2xTamper, Temp/Humi sensor, and my engineering spirit inside. All this is placed on 2 layers. –ûne is completely empty for wave soldering.#ESP32 runs everything again. This system for a safety area, which means everything should always work. To do this, another MCU is used as a WDT/supervisor for the ESP32 and entire board. #ESP32 #IoT
Some part for the new IoT gate controller.Fully integrated GSM module. It's can be used parallel (for 2/3  different SIM cards) for diversify GSM operator issues.

The miracle for the HW developer is a successful bringup.Next up is the firmware.I can definitely say that the most convenient/cheap Ethernet solution for IoT today is ESP32 module+LAN PHY. The STM32 is thrown off this pedestal.#ESP32

Finished routing. The main problem was installing two different RF bands (ISM and WiFi) in the same device with internal antennas only.Since the STM32 cannot be purchased, only popular "on stock" components are used (LAN8720/ESP32-WROOM32/any SPI FLASH/any MCP795x1 RTC with EUI-48, MC33063 for DC/DC).By the way, guess what the white mark is?#ESP32 #MICROCHIP #ST
Another IoT project and all of them are used!It's like I'm back in the era of the 6/8-pin MCU.#esp32

One evening I decided to listen to the radio on an old Walkman WM-FX193 player. I realized that there was something wrong with the sound at the output of my smartphone's headphones. The sound is very flat in confirmation with Walkman. I tested also Apple IPhone, but it's also flat. I think this is a payment for a digital amplifier in the phone or the modern way in engineering - music is just a background. So, to fix this situation, I made my player on the most popular analog amp -TDA2822. But the phone still has music - so the player will be modern! With Bluetooth!

My local customer asked me to create a system to control smart light switches via Apple ¬© Siri. In 2 days I made a proof of concept. So, when you use something from old parts - you understand what development really is. I imagined the time that engineers spent to create the best product. Which does what it was created for. Not for making money or just for development. For the purpose.

Once I read about a good technique that allows you to create a great motivation. You need to draw your life and fill the time what you have already lived. The week is used as the reference point. One cell for one week and a horizontal line for a year. I created an app that will allow you to see your progress right on your computer's desktop. I called this application is a LIVE Wallpaper. Your desktop wallpaper will change with time. After launching, you need to click on the icon in the tray and enter your date of birth and how long you are going to live (the app has a map with the life expectancy of the world). After that, add the app to the startup and every day you will see your progress. The app updates the wallpaper every day! You can download it from the link.https://lnkd.in/gv7kRGrNow you have the opportunity to finally do the MAIN thing. Use your time!#newideas #bestadvice #motivation #productivity #livewallpaper #wallpaper #windows

IoT for your coffee or teaMaking coffee is easy. But things often distract us so much that we forget about everything. Even about cold coffee. Drinking hot is bad. Drinking cold is even worse! But how do you know when the temperature will be optimal?So, meet the enemy of cold drinks and spoiled mood - IoTaste!This is a smart mug  coaster that measures the temperature of water and transfers it to the IoT cloud.  As soon as the temperature reaches the optimum value (~50 ¬∞C), a message is immediately transmitted to your phone via Telegram.I had the idea of smart mug  coaster for a long time, but my colleague Artem Boyarchuk kicked me for the implementation of this solution in the real device. He was looking for the best moment to add lemon to tea so that the vitamins are preserved.You can read more about this project herehttps://lnkd.in/g__9PrZThis project is almost a ready-made solution for monitoring equipment and predictive maintenance! If you have some project in the field of IoT - feel free to contact me.IoT will help you save not only your mood, but also your money!And yes, welcome to the future! With #NEWIDEAS and perfect warm coffee in your mug. #IoT
#newideas #IoT #cloud #development

My little weekend project. The system of teaching English words on biofeedback. Memory training is done in the form of a test. As a feedback, a weak electric shock is used if the answer was wrong . Learning new things is always stressful. :)To remove the habituation to unpleasant feedback, I introduced randomization of the duration of electric shock. In this case, the body can‚Äôt get used to the effect, because it can not predict its level.The most frequently used 2000 words of English with translation are stored into the device. The choice of options for the test is also made randomly.The basis of the device is the STM32F103C8T6 MCU. Information display-LCD Full color IPS. Powered by a Li-Ion battery with a TP4056-based charging module.#teslasuit with the suit is still waiting for the future. But it has already come.Create NOW.  #newideas

Naval Ravikant is one of the smartest entrepreneurs alive.He was an early investor in Uber, Twitter, Notion and a dozen other killer companies. He credits 10 rules for his success. Here‚Äôre his ideas on building wealth while being happy:1. Mindset matters.Adopt an abundance mindset. There's enough success to go around.Value learning more than money. It'll pay off in the long run.Focus on the process, not the outcome. It's about the journey, not the destination.2. Specific knowledge is gold.Hone a unique skill. Make it your secret weapon.Keep learning. Be curious and seek new experiences.Use your knowledge. Apply it in ways others can't.3. Build, don't chase.Create value, don't run after it. Make something people want.Attract success, don't pursue it. It'll find you.Do things you love. Passion fuels creativity and stamina.4. Equity is power.Own a piece. It's the real route to wealth.Be patient. Good things take time.Go for long-term wins. Quick bucks are fleeting.5. Leverage technology.Use tech to scale. It's the secret sauce of modern business.Automate mundane tasks. Keep your focus on big ideas.Keep up with trends. Tech moves fast. Keep pace.6. Productize yourself.Be the brand. Let your uniqueness shine.Share your journey. Others will connect with your authenticity.Turn your passion into a product. There's a market for everything.7. Embrace failure.Fail forward. Each failure is a step towards success.Learn from mistakes. They're valuable lessons.Remember, it's okay to fail. It's not okay to give up.8. Happiness is a choice.Be content with what you have. It's a key to happiness.Aim high, but stay grounded. Ambition and contentment can coexist.Don't tie happiness to success. They're not always linked.9. Networking is key.Build relationships. They're your biggest asset.Give more than you take. It's the secret to lasting connections.Be genuine. People connect with authenticity.10. Read widely. Knowledge is the doorway to new ideas.Learn from the best. They've left clues in their writings.Make reading a habit. It's an investment that pays back.
That is ingenious

7 books every entrepreneur needs to read:1. Empowered2. Zero to One3. Lean startup4. The mom's test5. Almanack of Naval Ravikant6. Who: The A Method for Hiring7. The Hard Thing About Hard ThingsWhat would you add?

My first startup was a disaster.I built the wrong product. Rented the wrong place.Blew my marketing.AND went bust with a $30k bill to pay.Here‚Äôs the story of my first business:Back in 2009, when the economic crisis hit,I rented a 4-room apartment on the first floor in an area where rich people lived in my town‚Ä¶Just to start my own business: kid‚Äôs education club‚Ä¶I wanted to teach kids about:‚Ä¢ math‚Ä¢ singing‚Ä¢ writing‚Ä¢ dancing‚Ä¢ geometryIn a class. Through this  business, I believed I can:‚Ä¢ become independent‚Ä¢ earn the first million‚Ä¢ travel the world‚Ä¢ retire earlyI circled my town back and forth to do a survey to see how fast I could be a millionaire from this biz - Thousands of children I can sell to- Not many educational services in my townWith one bold belief, I'd bank a million dollars in a yearNot to mention, many rich mommies in my town could throw money at meWoo-hoo !My dream to become a millionaire was about to get real‚Ä¶That day, I couldn‚Äôt sleep because I knew my life reality would finally be better than my night‚Äôs dreamI could :‚Ä¢ buy a sport car‚Ä¢ buy my own flat‚Ä¢ work 4 hours a week‚Ä¢ travel around the gloveAll from this little, but mine businessSounds good? Yes, not for longHere‚Äôs the reality:Two months in the biz, and just 7 people in the classThose rich mommies in my town wouldn‚Äôt throw money at meAnd don‚Äôt get me wrong‚Ä¶I didn‚Äôt expect to make $1,000,000 in two monthsBut I also didn‚Äôt expect emptiness in my wallet, eitherThat‚Äôs when reality slammed my ass even harderIt turned out, many mommies were happy to spend $50 on their nail polishments but not $100 on their child's education.Nice‚Ä¶I couldn‚Äôt get them convincedTo make things worse ? a neighbor's English club considered me an enemy and bullied me. I had to buy a video spy and hire a guard to ensure my survival.Just +$500 coming into my pocket, but -$10,000 already outTo murder my life even better?I bought a big billboard at my district‚Äôs entrance for $$$$$$$But It brought me ZERO prospect üôÇCould you imagine how my suffering was?...During the next 8 months, I had a profit only once..To sum up:I assumed. that because many rich moms lived in my town, they‚Äôd be ready to spend money on their kids' education.I didn't do proper research to understand my customers' real demands and pains.I learned the hard way that it's crucial to do the homework first... I made all these mistakes so you don‚Äôt have to. And if you‚Äôre asking about how that education business turned out‚Ä¶I lost it and all my investment. And left with $30k bill to pay. So, if you're thinking about starting a business, remember my story and learn from my mistakes:- Do market research- Be smart about your marketing- Understand your customers deeply- Launch an MVP to learn the real demandI wish you success in all your business endeavors!

The recession will kill most start-ups.If you want to survive it, follow these 10 tips:Protect Runway for at least 12 monthsDo you earn or do you burn?When you will run out of cash?The secret is if you‚Äôre pre-seed, prioritize product market fit. THEN focus on profitability and efficiency.Accept that your valuation will be 80% lower than a year agoWelcome to the new reality. You can hate it, or accept it.Public company multiplies went down by 80%.Don‚Äôt ignore the facts. Embrace them.Evaluate quickly if you need to downsize your teamKey metrics:‚Ä¢ Revenue‚Ä¢ Cash burn‚Ä¢ Headcount‚Ä¢ Cash balance including the day you run out of cashCreate 4-5 scenarios (from best to worst). Don‚Äôt get caught by surprise.If you have to make layoffs make them earlyMultiple rounds of layoffs are devastating and demoralizing.Be:‚Ä¢ human, kind, and generousAnd most importantly:Support the remaining staff. Reassure them.Keep the motivation high.Reward outstanding performance with stockGet your team invested in your company's success.Offer them a piece of the pie.Show you‚Äôre committed to a better future by sharing the rewardImprove product1. Analyse data2. Talk to your best clients3. Learn what features they love and hate4. Compare current user behavior vs the previous one5. Be creative, ask how you can build a better solutionPeople will always pay to solve a problem.Follow the Pareto PrincipleOften, 80% of revenue comes from 20% of clients.We get bogged down serving our worst.Instead, be bold. Fire them. Then focus on making the perfect product for your ideal client.Double down on who pays you the most.Get smart on pricingIf demand is high, don‚Äôt increase your price. Make your products more premium.If demand is low, don‚Äôt reduce your price. Instead, offer:‚Ä¢ Bundles‚Ä¢ More flexible payment terms‚Ä¢ Low entry offers with fewer featuresMake your product easier to buy.Hire the bestMost companies stop hiring in downturns.But this is the best time to find great talent. So never shut your doors.Open contacts.Underpromise , overdeliverThe most powerful business concept:Give more than they expect. The wow effect generates:‚Ä¢ More LTV‚Ä¢ More word of mouth‚Ä¢ More support from clientsBuild an army of superfans.TL:DR:‚Ä¢ Hire the best‚Ä¢ Protect Runway ‚Ä¢ Evaluate quickly ‚Ä¢ Improve product‚Ä¢ Get smart on pricing‚Ä¢ Follow the Pareto Principle‚Ä¢ Underpromise , overdeliver‚Ä¢ Be ready for lover valuation  ‚Ä¢ For layoffs make them early‚Ä¢ Reward outstanding performance If you are:‚Ä¢ Building a Startup ‚Ä¢ Searching for the PMF‚Ä¢ Struggling with Marketing & salesI have a great opportunity for you: For next weeks, I offer 3 free calls to help you with it. THE most-read book among startup founders:The Lean Startup.It‚Äôs sold over 1,000,000 copies worldwide.Here‚Äôs a breakdown of the 7 best ideas inside.Start with a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) to gather feedback quickly.:‚Ä¢ Launch an MVP as soon as possible.‚Ä¢ Measure customer behavior and engagement through data analysis.‚Ä¢ Learn from the data and adjust the product or business model accordingly.Engage with customers early and often: ‚Ä¢ Prioritize customer development.‚Ä¢ Continuously iterate and improve based on customer feedback.‚Ä¢ Use customer feedback to shape product and business strategy.Embrace a culture of continuous innovation:‚Ä¢ Release software updates frequently.‚Ä¢ Encourage experimentation and risk-taking.‚Ä¢ Continuously seek feedback from customers and stakeholders.Build a strong team:‚Ä¢ Build a diverse and talented team.‚Ä¢ Invest in the development of team members.‚Ä¢ Foster a culture of collaboration and learning.Prioritize learning over success and failure:‚Ä¢ Use data to make informed decisions.‚Ä¢ Use A/B testing to validate assumptions and hypotheses.‚Ä¢ Focus on actionable metrics that measure customer behavior and engagement.Use accessible, actionable, and relevant metrics:‚Ä¢ Ensure metrics are easily understood and shared.‚Ä¢ Focus on metrics that can guide business decisions.‚Ä¢ Avoid vanity metrics that may look good but don't provide meaningful information.Use the Five Whys to identify the root cause of a problem:‚Ä¢ Ask "why" five times to get to the root cause.‚Ä¢ Use this method to solve problems and make improvements.‚Ä¢ Move beyond treating the symptoms of a problem to reveal the root cause.

Seeking welltech trends? Here are some of them in short1. Telehealth: virtual consultations and online fitness classes are becoming more popular as people seek convenient and accessible wellness solutions.2. Wearables: the use of wearable technology, such as smartwatches and fitness trackers, to monitor and improve physical activity and health metrics is growing.3. Mental Health: the rise of mindfulness, meditation, and mental health apps to improve mental well-being and combat stress and anxiety.4. Personalized Wellness: tailored nutrition, fitness, and wellness plans based on individual biometrics, genetics, and lifestyle factors are becoming more prevalent.5. Plant-based and clean ingredients: a shift towards natural and organic products, with a focus on plant-based and clean ingredients in food, skincare, and supplements.6. Immersive Technology: the use of virtual and augmented reality technology in wellness experiences, such as virtual spa treatments and guided meditations.7. Corporate Wellness Programs: businesses are increasingly investing in employee wellness programs to improve productivity and reduce healthcare costs.8. Sustainability: a focus on environmentally sustainable practices, such as reducing waste and using biodegradable products, is becoming more important in the wellness industryHow do you measure the success of your business, and what metrics do you use?#welltech #wellnesstrends #SolveIt #predicitons #sustainability #health

A mobile app can boost e-commerce conversion rates üõçÔ∏èüìàAccording to Business of Apps, mobile apps demonstrate 130% higher conversion rates compared to websites. Why so? ü§îA mobile app provides more opportunities for user re-engagement. You can set up push notifications or send out emails to encourage customers to get back to the app when they get distracted and get their shopping done.Building trustworthy one-to-one relations also adds to better conversion rates. Come on, people love to sense increased attention and care. To get some inspiration on this matter, let‚Äôs turn to the Starbucks example.A popular coffee shop introduced in-app customer rewards way back in 2011. Three years later they launched gamification and started personalizing the experience by displaying games based on the user‚Äôs account activity. Plus, they actively utilize the power of AI to make their offers more individualized according to customer preferences, location, and purchase history. All these tactics help Starbucks to make users satisfied and keep conversions high.Here‚Äôs another example. For one of our clients, SolveIt team developed a mobile app for an e-commerce store that helped to increase the store‚Äôs revenue dramatically. üí∏ The application provides all the functions of an e-commerce store: a search with customizable filters, a catalog, a shopping cart, built-in payment services, and more. In the first month after the release, over 100K purchases were made through the mobile app! ü§© Check out the case here: https://lnkd.in/e24zJ5tMüìå Other benefits of a mobile app for an e-commerce business: https://lnkd.in/e-z6nGxa#ecommerce #ecommerceapp #mobileapplications #ecommercetips

Recently #Google Research launched the #AI model and pipeline "Photorealistic Monocular 3D Reconstruction of Humans Wearing Clothing" or PHORHUM. The model can make a fully 3D reconstruction of geometry and shaded surface colours of a person from just single photography. This pipeline opens new opportunities for #gamedev, #security, #entertainment and many other sectors. Also, the model can make 3D reconstruction in a video stream. This makes #opportunities for 3D video streams in #metaverse! This is really amazing!üßë‚Äçüíª Project: https://phorhum.github.ioüßë‚Äçüíª Video: https://lnkd.in/dwj3ewqF

Some thoughts about my First Month at Cegeka in Greece üí° :Discovering Cegeka was a serendipitous encounter. When Vlad-Florin Melechett contacted me on LinkedIn, he initiated a conversation that would change my career trajectory. From our very first interaction, I felt an immediate connection with him and Andra Antonescu, who warmly introduced me to the people-centric culture that defines Cegeka. But I knew I wanted to be part of this journey during my meeting with Tom De Voss, where he unveiled the company's ambitious plans for expansion in Greece.As the first employee of Cegeka Greece, my HRBP and Site Manager role demands multitasking and adaptability, particularly as we work towards establishing the Cegeka brand. Despite being physically alone in Athens (till now ;) ), I have never felt isolated. ‚ÄúEmbrace & Evolve"üåû EMBRACE comes from the outmost important skill to continually discover more about yourself and, at the same time, own it and live it!Own your strengths, own your pitfalls, own your needs, your personality, and your boundaries!üìà  EVOLVE comes from building yourself step by step after embracing all of the above. From building such a mindset that you won't see blockages around you, but just opportunities. From taking those opportunities to learn more and add another step on your evolution path.üí° What I discovered in my mentoring sessions together with my mentees is that typically everyone wants to evolve and wants to get to the next step, but most of the time, without knowing and embracing themselves, most of the time without knowing where they genuinely want to go, or what suits them best, where they will thrive.üóí Last year, I started noting many experiences that triggered me during the mentoring sessions since I started doing those almost three years ago. And from all those discoveries, lessons, and "aha" moments, I created "Embrace & Evolve," a program designed from the true learnings of people that wanted to get to the next level of their lives.Are you asking yourself whether you need to know now with certainty who you are, where you want to go, and what you want to achieve? Sometimes the path is the goal, and it is only essential to aim in the right direction. The destination then often appears by itself. I intend to support us together in finding the right direction. And it's only YOU who knows which one that is.And because another of my discoveries is that "together is always better for evolving," the program is designed for you to learn from other people and not only to work with me. The groups are selected so that participants are very diverse (6-8 people max), for you to be exposed to different perspectives and other ways of thinking, so we can disrupt patterns and old ways of doing things.¬†So we can evolve together!If you want more details and want to sign in, please DM me, and we will go from there. Let's have a fantastic 2023 together!#embraceyourself #evolve #learningeveryday #skillsdevelopment #opportunities #mindset

Future trends in #outsourcing and how they will impact businesses:‚Ä¢ The rise of automation and AI.As AI and automation continue to advance, outsourcing providers are incorporating these technologies into their services. This will lead to more efficient and cost-effective outsourcing solutions for businesses, allowing them to focus on their core competencies while leaving repetitive tasks to automation.‚Ä¢ The growing importance of data security and privacy. As businesses become more reliant on outsourcing, they must ensure that their data and intellectual property are protected. Outsourcing providers will need to implement strong security measures and comply with data privacy regulations to meet the needs of their clients.‚Ä¢ The rise of remote work. As more companies adopt remote work policies, outsourcing providers are also adapting to remote work arrangements. This means that businesses can access a wider pool of talent from around the world, without the need for physical office space.As you see, the future of outsourcing holds many new trends that will impact the industry and the businesses that use it. From the rise of AI and automation to the growing importance of data security and privacy, outsourcing providers must adapt to meet the evolving needs of businesses.What do you think of the listed trends? Perhaps there's something else you'd love to mention? Feel free to share!#itoutsourcing #softwaredevelopment #ai #remotework #software #tech

Hi there!Have you already heard that Italy has become the first Western country to block an advanced chatbot - ChatGPT?The Italian data-protection authority said there were privacy concerns relating to the model, which was created by US start-up OpenAI and is backed by Microsoft.The regulator said it would ban and investigate OpenAI "with immediate effect".Millions of people have used ChatGPT since it launched in November 2022.It can answer questions using natural, human-like language and it can also mimic other writing styles, using the internet as it was in 2021 as its database.Microsoft has spent billions of dollars on it and it was added to Bing last month.It has also said that it will embed a version of the technology in its Office apps, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.There have been concerns over the potential risks of artificial intelligence (AI), including its threat to jobs and the spreading of misinformation and bias.Earlier last week key figures in tech, including Elon Musk, called for these types of AI systems to be suspended amid fears the race to develop them was out of control.Consumer advocacy group BEUC also called on EU and national authorities - including data-protection watchdogs - to investigate ChatGPT and similar chatbots, following the filing of a complaint in the US."There are serious concerns growing about how ChatGPT and similar chatbots might deceive and manipulate people. These AI systems need greater public scrutiny, and public authorities must reassert control over them," - warned Ursula Pachl, deputy director general of BEUC.Do you agree with this statement?I will be glad if you share your opinion on this matter.https://lnkd.in/dr5qPs-7#microsoft #ai #technology #tech #artificialintelligence

üòâ Hi guys, today, I would like to highlight the topic of what data science trends for fintech companies that could shape the industry in the coming years:1. Increased use of ML: Machine learning algorithms can help fintech companies to streamline their operations, improve customer experience and make better decisions. For instance, machine learning can be used to detect fraudulent activities, personalize financial products and services, and optimize investment portfolios.2. Use of big data analytics: Fintech companies are increasingly relying on big data analytics to identify patterns, trends, and insights that can help them to make better business decisions. With the help of big data analytics, fintech companies can better understand customer behavior, market trends, and risks.3. Adoption of blockchain technology: Blockchain technology has the potential to revolutionize the way financial transactions are processed and verified. Fintech companies are exploring ways to leverage blockchain technology to improve security, reduce costs, and enhance transparency in financial transactions.4. Expansion of fintech partnerships: Fintech companies are partnering with traditional financial institutions to expand their reach and offer more comprehensive financial services. These partnerships are expected to increase in the coming years, as fintech companies continue to disrupt the financial industry.5. Focus on privacy and security: With the increase in digital financial transactions, fintech companies are increasingly focusing on privacy and security. To build trust with customers, fintech companies are investing in advanced security measures, such as biometric authentication, multifactor authentication, and encryption.6. Emphasis on explainable AI: As the use of AI becomes more prevalent in fintech, there is growing concern around the transparency and explainability of AI models. Fintech companies are focusing on developing AI models that are transparent and explainable, in order to build trust with customers and regulators.7. Use of natural language processing: Natural language processing (NLP) is being increasingly used in fintech to improve customer experience. Fintech companies are using NLP to develop chatbots and virtual assistants that can interact with customers in a more natural and intuitive way.Do you agree?) üòâ #fintech #ai

Customer data platforms (CDPs) enables to unify and integrate customer data into one single database. A CDP can grab information from online and offline sources such as websites, mobile apps, and email platforms to offer a complete view of the customer. After retrieving this data, a CDP can then help companies predict the optimal next move with a particular user. This allows businesses to learn what needs to be done to retain specific customers. Some lessons we have learned from creating an interface for SmartLogic: üëá1. Knowledge makes everything simpler. Before tackling interface design, it's crucial to conduct thorough research, understand the problems you need to solve, the goals you aim to achieve and analyze your competitors. This approach will streamline your design process and help you create a better product.2. Minimize the number of objects and elements in your design instead of adding more. Aim to achieve your goals through simplification and avoiding unnecessary clutter. Use as few elements as possible while maintaining an appealing aesthetic and functionality.3. Organize your design. Ensure you reuse elements from your UI Kit, avoiding minor alterations to individual components. This approach saves significant time during development and guarantees a polished, cohesive interface.4. Embrace the use of clear space. A "light" interface often appears more simplistic, so resist the urge to fill every available white space with elements.Read the full case study on how we created an interface for Smart Logic on our website: https://lnkd.in/eTaVGFUa#design #interfacedesign #ui #development #ux #ecommerce #web #platform #smotrow

Some experience of  product management that would like to share with my audience. let's go!!! The first thing I would say to myself is - listen to your customers!!! Now I know this sounds obvious but I'm constantly shocked by how littlewe're listening to our customers, It's always surprising!Your job as a product manager to be maniacally focused on understanding your customers problems and you can not do that if you're not listening to them. I've interviewed over 100 product managers at different companiesin the last year and I'm constantly shocked by how few of them have a basic understanding of the customer problem that they're trying to solve. You cannot solve the customers problem without understanding it and when you don't listen to your customers you end up building solutions for problems that nobody has.So the first thing I'd like to say is - spend more time to listening your customers. :) But the next thing I am going to say is - STOP listening to your customers when it comes to solutions. hahahah )So your customers are the least qualified people to come up with solutions. We're not typing machines or stenographers if we just wrote down everything the customer said and and we put it into our products.Anybody could do our jobs right? Very right!So listen to your customers to understand their problem but don't listen to your customers when it comes to building solutions. That's your job!!!Thanks for reading. To be continued... #building #productmanagement #experience #startup #startups #productdevelopment #productownership #productowner

How to Choose the Right Software Development Partner for Your Business Needs: A Checklist of 5 Keys Based on My Personal Experience in the IndustryAs a founder and tech product developer, I‚Äôve spent the past 8 years building products for clients in various industries such as media and entertainment, fintech, and edTech. Over this time, I‚Äôve assembled a team of over 30 passionate individuals who share my deep interest in technology, such as:üîÜ AI and MLüîÜ Serverless and microservice architecturesüîÜ Angular and React frameworksüîÜ Mobile applications with Flutter and DartüîÜ Node.js and Python for scalable SaaS solutionsüîÜ Adobe CC panels.Here, I want to share my key takeaways, approaches, and values that I implement in First Line Outsourcing to help solve many of the challenges businesses face in today's rapidly advancing technological landscape. This list will be useful if you are looking to choose an outsourcing software development partner (SDP).üî∏ Make sure you speak the same language (literally) with your SDP. Terms and technical requirements vary from industry to industry. At FLO, we firmly believe that clear communication and a deep understanding of the context and industry are key elements of successful projects. Deep industry knowledge and over 250 implemented projects are clues to understanding customer requests.üî∏ Make sure you set clear and measurable goals before the start. We immerse ourselves in the details of each client's product goals, making them our own. This approach enables us to come up with solutions on the fly while keeping the client's objectives at the forefront.üî∏ Territory and country-specific - make sure your SDP has all necessary requirements. We understand that many businesses face unique industry-specific challenges, like a shortage of qualified, reliable, and available software engineers in the US and EU. We offer our clients top-tier development services at a price lower than hiring in-house developers.üî∏ Meet the team and your project manager before commitment. All of my team members are dedicated to staying on the cutting edge of technological advancements and methodologies, including new languages, frameworks, and best practices. This ensures our clients receive the highest quality products without exceeding their budgets.üî∏ Ask for a case study or recommendation. Our commitment to building long-term partnerships with our clients has resulted in several multi-year partnerships. We have worked with some clients for more than six years, which is a true testament to the trust of our customers and something I‚Äôm proud of.As the Founder of First Line Outsourcing, I am here to ensure that my company helps clients tackle the challenges they face in the ever-evolving technology sector. I am proud of my team of passionate individuals who use cutting-edge technologies and techniques to bring clients' ideas to life while providing a professional, cost-effective business solution.#business #team #tech

I wanted to take a moment to highlight the transformative power of open coffee events happening at Startup Lisboa. ‚òïüí°This is not just about a cup of coffee, but about the stirring conversations and vibrant exchanges that happen over it. It's an opportunity for startup enthusiasts, innovators, and dreamers to come together in a casual, free-form environment.Open coffee events can be a unique experience, where you're given the chance to meet like-minded individuals, share your thoughts and learn from their ideas. They're the melting pot where seeds of innovations are often sown, and can be the perfect platform for those seeking advice, partnerships, or just a friendly ear to share their entrepreneurial journey.The beauty of these sessions is their informality. No pitches. No hard sales. Just dialogue. It's about establishing a community, a support network, where every idea is appreciated and every opinion matters.As someone who's been a part of this vibrant ecosystem, I'm always excited to meet new people, learn about their unique concepts, and share my experiences with them. We grow as individuals and professionals by learning and evolving through interaction, and these meet-ups are a great catalyst for that.I encourage everyone, whether you're a startup veteran or a newbie, to take advantage of these open coffee events. You never know, the next big idea could be just a coffee conversation away! üí¨‚òïüöÄRemember, it's not just about networking, it's about growing, learning, and sharing. So come join us, share your stories, hear others', and let's brew some success together.Thanks, Richard Lucas for the organization and idea üôÇ#OpenCoffee #Networking #Collaboration #Innovation #Startups #IdeasBrewing #lisboa

Wireframes vs Mockups vs Prototypes‚åöÔ∏èüí∏ Launch sooner, succeed faster: Transform your trading app idea into MVP in 3 weeksFor those involved in developing mobile and web applications, it's crucial to agree on the stages of UI/UX design. No doubt, designers, customers, and stakeholders understand the differences between wireframes, mockups, and prototypes. Today, we won't delve into the distinctions üëâ but focus on the timeframe, which plays a vital role in budget allocation.In this post, we'll use InvestEase, our trading platform concept, as an example. This platform aims to simplify the trading process by presenting a wealth of data on a single screen.üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Nadya, UI/UX designer: "Creating 4 wireframes took me 6 hours, 8 hours for mockups, and 16 hours to complete the UI design with logic. The main functions of the application are limit and stop-loss orders, margin trading, wallet integration, two-factor authentication, and trading alerts. Developing a design for a full-fledged MVP typically will take about 3 weeks."When working on a project, it's not necessary to develop wireframes, mockups, and prototypes sequentially. To save resources, you can choose one or two formats and utilize them equally. The choice depends on the following factors:1Ô∏è‚É£ Your requirements: If you need a general design view of the future product, ask a designer to create a mockup. If you require detailed technical documentation, opt for a wireframe. For influencing the product's functionality logic, a detailed prototype will be helpful.2Ô∏è‚É£ Type of project: For new designs, begin with wireframes and then proceed to mockups. For existing designs, skip wireframes and focus solely on mockups.3Ô∏è‚É£ Time and resource constraints: If you have a limited budget and urgency, stick to mockups. In the case of a complex site/app, consider a prototype for comprehensive testing.4Ô∏è‚É£ Level of teamwork: If designers and developers have a solid understanding, you can bypass wireframes and move straight to mockups.At Codabrasoft LLC, we value open communication and client input. We voice our thoughts and explain the pros and cons of each direction. If you need assistance in designing a functional yet user-centric product, reach out to us, and we'll be in touch promptly ü§óüìû Let's transform your concept into a robust prototype and ultimately a fully realized app - https://lnkd.in/ggu7e3C5 #trading #design #business #userexperience #mobileapplications

A notable historical example of teamwork is the Apollo 11 mission in 1969 NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration. The mission involved a team of astronauts, engineers, scientists, and support staff working together to accomplish the goal of landing humans on the moon. The team faced numerous challenges, but through collaboration, innovation, and meticulous planning, they overcame each obstacle. Astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin, with the support of Michael Collins in lunar orbit, successfully landed on the moon, marking a monumental achievement for humankind. The Apollo 11 mission stands as a testament to the power of teamwork, determination, and the remarkable things that can be accomplished when individuals unite toward a common purpose.#teambuilding #achievement #collaboration

This message is addressed to parents. It's essential to understand the value of supporting our children through their mistakes and challenges. It's common for us to feel embarrassed or ashamed when our children misbehave in front of others, but it's vital to provide a safe and supportive environment for them to learn from their mistakes.Our duty is to remember that children are still learning and growing, and public shaming can negatively impact their emotional well-being and development. Instead, we should prioritize their emotional needs and have thoughtful conversations with them in private to show our sadness and emotions about the case.As responsible parents, it's our purpose to protect our children from psychological trauma that can be caused by public humiliation. Let's work towards creating a society where children feel safe and supported, and their emotional well-being is prioritized.‚ù§Ô∏è üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ ‚ù§Ô∏è #family #parenting #society #love

The Meta-led Massively Multilingual Speech (MMS) project has made remarkable strides in expanding language coverage and improving the performance of speech recognition and synthesis models. By training self-supervised models on approximately 500,000 hours of speech data across 1,400 languages, the project significantly reduced the reliance on labelled data. Evaluation of the models trained on the MMS data revealed impressive results. In a comparison with OpenAI‚Äôs Whisper, the MMS models exhibited half the word error rate while covering 11 times more languages.You can study the chart by following the link: https://lnkd.in/gdT8TuRb#data #ai #voicerecognition

Precision oncology has revolutionized the way we think about cancer treatment. With the help of digital solutions, doctors can now tailor treatments to the specific genetic makeup of each patient's cancer cells, leading to more effective and personalized care.One such solution is the use of genomic sequencing, which provides doctors with a comprehensive view of a patient's tumor DNA. This information allows them to identify specific mutations that are driving the cancer's growth and select targeted therapies that can block these mutations.Another digital tool is artificial intelligence (AI), which can analyze vast amounts of patient data to identify patterns and predict how different treatments will affect individual patients. This allows doctors to make more informed decisions and provide highly personalized care.Overall, precision oncology and digital solutions are transforming cancer care, giving patients new hope and better outcomes.#artificialintelligence #oncology #digital #data #ai #help

Patient medication apps typically offer a range of features that help users manage their medications and track their progress. Some common features of patient medication apps include:‚ûñMedication reminders: Users can set up alerts to remind them to take their medications on time.‚ûñMedication tracking: Users can track the medications they take, including the dosage, frequency, and any special instructions.‚ûñRefill reminders: Users can receive alerts when it's time to refill their prescriptions.‚ûñMedication information: Potential side effects, interactions with other medications, and instructions for use.‚ûñInteraction checking: Some apps can check for potential drug interactions based on a user's medication list.‚ûñPill identification: Users can use their smartphone camera to identify pills.‚ûñHealth tracking: Some apps allow users to track their vital signs, such as blood pressure and blood sugar, to monitor their overall health.‚ûñHealth records: Users can keep track of their health records, including medications, allergies, and medical history, all in one place.‚ûñCommunication with healthcare providers.‚ûñMedication cost information.If you want to create medication tracking software and need help, feel free to¬†contact me!#healthcare #medical #software #medication #medicalapp

Fun fact about me: I have a twin brother ;) But today I'd like to discuss not real but digital twins! It is a virtual model designed to accurately reflect a physical object. So the question is, why is it so popular? 
The global digital twins market is set to reach $73.5 billion by 2027. The technology offers such benefits as cost reduction, revenue growth, faster time to market, and informed decision-making.
Sure, it's important to prepare adequately to implement digital twins successfully. Let me number key areas to focus on:
üìå Established Vision:
Determine the purpose, expected outcomes, required computational resources, and data attributes.
üìå Infrastructure Readiness:
Ensure you have the necessary physical modeling capabilities.
üìå Financial Capabilities:
Consider infrastructure, updates, storage, and training investments.
üìå Data Preparedness:
Identify and collect the necessary data for replicating the physical system or product.
üìå Security Posture:
Implement data security measures like encryption, firewalls, and access controls.With digital twins, you can unlock a lot of benefits for your business.I‚Äôm curious, have you practiced this technology in your companies? Please share your experience in the comments below!#digitaltwins #technologies #businessdevelopment

Increasingly, companies are turning to robotic process automation (RPA) to eliminate repetitive tasks and free up employees' time for more valuable tasks. RPA scenarios range from generating an automatic response to an email to deploying thousands of bots. Many CIOs are turning to RPA to streamline enterprise operations and reduce costs.üìå Rather than spending time on mundane rules-based business processes, businesses can dedicate more time to serving customers or other higher-value tasks. Alternatively, some see RPA as a stopgap before intelligent automation (IA) via Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence tools.Here are some key benefits of RPA for any business: ‚úÖ Typically, bots require no custom software or deep integration of systems and are low-cost and easy to implement.‚úÖ Software robots can potentially increase a team's productivity by 35% to 50% when properly configured.‚úÖ By integrating RPA with cognitive technologies like ML, speech recognition, and natural language processing, organizations can automate higher-order tasks that previously required human judgment and perception.Are you ready to rely on such robots in your business? ‚Äú The Top 5 Resume Pitfalls Cloud Engineers Should Avoid (and How to Overcome Them) ‚Äì A Comprehensive Guide‚ÄùAs a cloud engineer, your resume serves as the gateway to your dream job. It's often the first glimpse potential employers have of your skills and experience, so it's crucial to craft a resume that stands out. As a recruiter, I've come across countless resumes and witnessed some common mistakes that cloud engineers make. Here's a detailed look at the top 5 resume pitfalls and how to overcome them, so you can make a powerful impression on potential employers.Lack of Specificity A generic resume won't cut it in today's competitive job market. It's essential to tailor your resume to the specific role and company you're targeting. To do this, review the job description and identify the keywords and requirements that align with your skills and experience. Incorporate these terms into your resume to demonstrate your suitability for the position and increase the likelihood of passing Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS).Overemphasis on Technical Skills Technical skills are undoubtedly critical for cloud engineers, but don't forget to showcase your soft skills as well. Employers value professionals who can communicate effectively, work well in teams, and solve problems creatively. Balance your technical proficiencies with these interpersonal attributes to create a well-rounded resume that appeals to a broader range of employers.Too Long or Too Short Striking the right balance in resume length can be tricky. As a rule of thumb, aim for a 1-2 page resume that's concise yet detailed enough to showcase your skills and experience. Remember, hiring managers often spend just a few seconds scanning resumes, so it's crucial to highlight your most relevant qualifications without overwhelming the reader with excessive information.Poor Formatting An aesthetically pleasing resume is easier to read and leaves a lasting impression. Use professional resume templates to ensure a visually appealing layout. Incorporate bullet points, headings, and white space to break up the text and make it easy to scan. Additionally, stick to a readable font and consistent formatting throughout your resume.Lack of Accomplishments Your resume should go beyond listing your responsibilities; it needs to highlight your accomplishments and the impact you've made in previous roles. Use quantifiable metrics and specific examples to showcase your contributions. For instance, instead of writing "Managed cloud infrastructure," opt for "Reduced cloud infrastructure costs by 30% by optimizing resource allocation and implementing auto-scaling policies."By steering clear of these common mistakes and focusing on showcasing your relevant skills, experience, and accomplishments, you'll create a resume that leaves a lasting impression on potential employers. Remember, your resume is your ticket to landing interviews.#ResumeTips #CloudEngineers #JobSearch

A frontend developer arrived in Thailand and worked on his laptop on the beach before going for a swim, leaving his laptop on a sunbed. When he returned, he saw a monkey sitting next to his laptop. He laughed, shrugged it off, and went to eat. Later, he received an email from his employer saying that even the monkey was better at the job than him, and he was fired, with the monkey being hired instead. The frontend developer wasn't too bothered and thought to himself, "Well, I still have enough money for a couple of months, maybe I'll find another job." After a month, he received another email from his employer, offering him a job. The frontend developer asked, "What happened to the monkey?" The employer replied, "The monkey is now a team leader, but we still need frontend developers." üòÖüêµüíª
