This morning I got a call from the company (which I first heard about this very morning), a manager told me that I was one of the "winners" (of an unknown lottery) and offered to do a "quick check-in". When I refused, the girl quickly hung up on me.If such a primitive scheme still exists, I can conclude that it works. How many people have already provided the intruders with their personal information?So today I want to remind you how to protect yourself from scammers:1. Restrict access via AirDrop when you're in public places. That way, strangers won't be able to drop malicious content on you via AirDrop.2. Create strong passwords. An analysis of 5 million broken accounts shows that "123456" tops the list for the 4th year in a row. Remember, "1234" is a bad password. So is the word "password." And the word "monkey" (interesting fact, this password is one of the most popular).3. Personalized pricing. Some sellers analyze your data and find out how much you might pay for an item. For example, Uber knows that you'll agree to pay more if your phone's battery dies. And Staples shows customers different prices depending on their location. So before you buy something expensive online, go to the product page from a different device/in incognito mode. Big brother is watching youüëÄ

One of my favorite stories that I‚Äôm going to share with you today is how a simple decision may give impressive results! üòé It happened several months ago when the client had encountered troubles in attracting investors. In one of the meetings, we scratched the surface of the website speed of operation. The project we're working on was designed to be an intermediary between the customer and the manufacturer. Its goal is to allow the users to compare the selected items and choose an optimal one for their needs. When loading the company's page, a request was made for a third-party service, which stores info about the company's tariff plans. Then this data was sent back on the same path. And all this process took about 5 seconds. It's too long for a website user.  Our solution was simple but helped at its best! Instead of checking the info under the standard protocols, we created a shared database, where the info was automatically checked. This way the result was shown to the user four times as fast. Today the client can attract more users to his website. By the way, recently their team has attracted a huge investor! And we‚Äôd really like to believe that our solution played its part. What happened next, though, is strictly confidentialüòÑ

Everyone knows that you can‚Äôt make an omelet without breaking a few eggs. Sometimes you just can't escape bad luck. But we don‚Äôt deny failures - we learn on them. And I‚Äôm going to tell you about the case we‚Äôve learned on. It happened with one of our projects not so long ago. Client launched a promo campaign for his site (that we wrote) to attract the customers. He didn‚Äôt warn us about it so the servers had failed because of the high activity on the site. Unfortunately that time we couldn‚Äôt fix it since the site‚Äôs server wasn‚Äôt scalable. At the moment site had about 15000 users. We called our client as soon as possible to approve the workflow for promo campaigns and decided to move onto another type of server with automated scaling. This situation helped us to create a perfect scheme of operation: The client warns us about a new campaign ‚ûú we turn on additional servers and leave ‚Äúon duty‚Äù developer. In other cases, the additional servers are off in order to cut client‚Äôs costs. Now the site has around 30000 users and the promo campaign never caused our servers to fail. So we know that communication with the client can‚Äôt be underestimated. This is why it‚Äôs crucial to talk through all your plans on the software with your developers (marketing plans included).

OpenAI GPT-4 is about to be released. It's multimodal!Microsoft Germany CTO, Andreas Braun, confirmed that GPT-4 is coming within a week of March 9, 2023 and that it will be multimodal. Multimodal AI means that it will be able to operate within multiple kinds of input, like video, images and sound.GPT-3 and GPT-4 are both language models developed by OpenAI, but there are several key differences between the two.GPT-3, or Generative Pre-trained Transformer 3, was first introduced in June 2020. It is trained on a massive dataset of over 570GB of text data, which includes a diverse range of sources such as books, articles, and websites. GPT-3 has 175 billion parameters, making it the largest language model to date.One of the most notable features of GPT-3 is its ability to perform a wide range of natural language processing tasks with high accuracies, such as language translation, summarization, and question answering, without the need for fine-tuning. This is made possible by its large dataset and powerful architecture.

Over the past four years, I've had the opportunity to speak with numerous entrepreneurs and investors, and one key observation I've made is that there are four important hypotheses to test before scaling your business üéØ1Ô∏è‚É£ Firstly, identifying a client segment that is already struggling with the problem you want to solve is crucialThese are individuals who have attempted to address the problem through various means and are willing to pay for a more effective solution. Market research and customer interviews are some effective tools you can use to identify and understand your target market.2Ô∏è‚É£ Secondly, you need to ensure that you have the necessary resources, including funding, personnel, and technical expertise, to build a product that meets the needs of your target segment. Developing a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) and conducting user testing is an effective way to build a product that satisfies your target customers.3Ô∏è‚É£ Thirdly, it's essential to develop a solution with suitable unit economics that can sustain your business model in the long run. Conducting a thorough financial analysis and using metrics such as Cost of Customer Acquisition (CAC) and Lifetime Value (LTV) can help you develop a sustainable business model. For instance, you could use the Business Model Canvas to map out your business model and identify potential revenue streams.4Ô∏è‚É£ Finally, you need to determine whether your target market is large enough to generate a significant return on investment. Understanding your market sizing the Total Addressable Market (TAM) and Serviceable Available Market (SAM) can help you determine the size of your target market and potential return on investment.By testing these hypotheses, you can increase your chances of success and minimize risk when scaling your business. So, take your time, do your research, and focus on the right segments before investing in scaling up! üöÄ#business #research #investment #entrepreneurs #funding #marketresearch

A short post about why you should try Design Sprint in your company ü§óDesign Sprints are a popular methodology for quickly solving complex problems and testing new ideas in a short amount of timeCompanies may benefit from using Design Sprints because theyüéØAllow for rapid prototyping and testing of new ideas, which can save time and resources in the long run.üéØBring cross-functional teams together to collaborate and generate new solutions, which can lead to more innovative ideas.üéØHelp to identify and validate potential solutions early on in the development process, reducing the risk of failure.üéØAllow teams to make data-driven decisions, as they can validate assumptions and test solutions with real users.üéØHelp teams to move quickly, with a clear goal and plan, which can increase productivity and results.Overall, Design Sprints can be a valuable tool for companies looking to quickly validate new ideas and bring innovative solutions to market.#design #productivity #test #hypothesis

Do brainstorms, strategy sessions, or just a simple plan on your own ‚Äî what will lead you from point A to point BBack to my scheme ‚Äî we have a mission, goal, and CEO, whose role is to keep his team inside the mission corridor and move them toward our main goal. The more green arrows you have the faster you will move to your goal. Scaling eCommerce lessons by Carolien Rijkse-Kamerling Ausnutria, Marlot Bielschowskij Stoov¬Æ | We warm people, not the planet., Camilla Krogh Olaf Hussein üí¨ Cross-cultural communication is a key factor in scaling an eCommerce business to other countries. Merely translating your website into the language of the target country is not sufficient. While the translation may be grammatically correct, it can still feel foreign to the local audience, making your brand and products appear unfamiliar in the new market.There was a good case from Carolien. Ausnutria expanded from Nederland to Germany. Although Dutch and German may seem similar, a direct translation of Dutch product descriptions into German felt odd to German consumers. The language used didn‚Äôt align with how young mothers, the target audience of the brand, commonly speak. To establish a connection with the new audience, it was crucial to adapt the language and phrases to match their everyday usage.üîéThis adaptation is also essential for SEO (Search Engine Optimization). Simply translating search terms will not capture the actual search behavior of the new target audience. Instead, you need to delve into their unique search requests and behavior to optimize your website accordingly.

Implement basic data governance processes to ensure responsible and ethical data usage.üåç Create an open ecosystem: Foster collaboration and data exchange within an open ecosystem. Engage with peers and stakeholders to promote interoperability and structure data for easy access.üîó Connectivity instead of data replication: Avoid replicating data across multiple systems. Prioritize connectivity to enable seamless access to data without duplication.üí° Experiment with other business models: Explore alternative business models that can enhance customer relationships and provide opportunities to gather more data for meaningful purposes. Adapt your IT landscape and system design accordingly.Check how accurate product recommendations gives Merchat AI https://lnkd.in/dxACWv3K Bloomberg GPT has been purpose-built from scratch for finance and has 50 billion parameters. On AI: "Software is a just a tool to help accomplish something for people - many programmers never understood that. Keep your eyes on the delivered value, and don't over focus on the specifics of the tools" - John CarmackI lead one of Google‚Äôs Developer organizations and am regularly using tools like ChatGPT, Bard, CoPilot, and other LLM-powered tools to better educate myself.As we continue to navigate the ever-evolving landscape of AI and software development, it's essential to remember that, at its core, software is just a tool to help accomplish something for people. It won‚Äôt be a replacement for the human mind, but as a tool that works in tandem with our brains to accelerate success.Now AI is making strides in assisting developers with bootstrapping their work through partial automation, such as prototyping small, well-defined problems. However, it still has a long way to go to be reliable for more complex development tasks. It's crucial to build awareness of AI's capabilities, but also not to become (overly) worried about its potential impact on the industry. If you‚Äôre uncertain about the future, you are more likely to be replaced by an engineer who knows how to be effective using AI tools as an aid vs. being fully replaced by AI just like that."If you build full product skills and use the best tools for the job, which today might be hand coding, but later may be Al guiding, you will probably be fine." - CarmackIt's essential to view yourself as a problem solver who uses technology, rather than simply a "coder" who can be easily replaced. A software engineer's job isn't to write code but to solve problems and make decisions. It takes many decisions to go from an idea to a working application, and these decisions are made by a team of people with various skills, including designers, copywriters, and engineers. While AI is becoming more adept at handling common problems and refining code, it cannot replace the nuanced decision-making needed for successful software development. It's important to acknowledge that tools like ChatGPT are not General AI, and they have limitations. They can't (yet) reason logically about problems without known solutions or fully evaluate the drawbacks and tradeoffs of different approaches (yet). Where this may not be the case is if folks are just copy/pasting StackOverflow snippets, a much smaller % of an engineer‚Äôs time. Here‚Äôs where AI has saved me time:- Solving well-defined problems with a (probably) known solution (e.g. write me a React component for an image gallery using CSS Grid)- Solving simpler syntax or logic problems (e.g. i think this part of my code has a bug, can you fix it?)- Helping me learn new concepts or languages faster It‚Äôs also made plenty of mistakes. All that said, now is a great time to learn.We must be cautious not to overestimate the impact of AI on the near future while underestimating its effect on the distant future.#softwareengineering #ai #productivity

üòé How Glowosh was born... #people #quality #tourism My partner and I have been running a small tour company for the past 6 years. We offer tours, and excursions by vans in Lisbon and in the region, making sure that our tourists are having a great time in Portugal by exploring the historical and authentic sites while immersing them in the local culture! An important factor when you operate in tourism is making sure your customers are satisfied. It actually became an obsession on different levels. Ensuring quality, having a good relationship with our tourists and guaranteeing the customer satisfaction. You can achieve these results by many actions but for us, it started by starting the tourists journey with a clean van!¬†The clean van is actually the first impression they will have about the tour, so of course after each tour we made sure to bring our vans to the washing station to prepare and clean our vans for the tours the next day.Like anyone who has a car knows that it takes a lot of time and effort to go to the car wash stations, get stuck in the traffic, wait in the line, spend time and cash to wash it, and eventually come back home exhausted, cold and wasted one hour of your life which could be spent for kids and family or for something what really matters to you. While struggling with this problem throughout the years, a solution came to our minds one of those days. This solution helped us to save hours by using ecological waterless products and microfiber towels to wash our vans manually just in front of our office. This waterless on demand solution was surprisingly cheap, efficient, and did not require much effort.Throughout the time we developed our own technique "how to" wash a car in 3 efficient steps, which allowed our guides to learn and apply it very fast.Very naturally, our colleagues - tour guides and tour companies started asking us how we managed to keep our vans shining, for so long. Quickly we were invited to do some test washes on their vans¬† for a symbolic price to test the concept.This brought us to a conclusion that there was a real need for a product which we invented. We saw the appreciation of the tour guides to relieve them from this pain and by providing an instant car wash, we saw the appreciation of the company owners, we saw the appreciation of the tourists who were leaving more and more positive reviews about the hygiene of the vans.Here is where the Glowosh ü¶Ñ was born! It was born in our hearts, hearts of those people who saw the instant impact of our invention and who believed in us and our product!It is only the beginning!Stay tuned..

Each project should be preceded by specifying goals and assumptions. Business needs are closely related to them and constitute the basis for stable product development. We try to help our client to answer these questions at the very beginning to ensure an optimal range of services:üí°What is the business need of your digital project?üí°What difficulties you or your target audience face on a daily basis?üí°When would you like to implement ready software?üí°Are there any restrictions that may hinder the implementation of the project?üí°What effects do you want to achieve with the software?üí° Why do you want to create a specific product?

End-to-end testing is a process of testing an application from all the layers ‚Äì right from the front-end to all the way through the back-end, its interfaces, and final endpoints.Here are the 6 reasons why do you need end-to-end Test Automation:‚úÖ Saves testers time, and reduces costs for organization. With automated testing, it‚Äôs less thought-provoking and less memorable, which ultimately requires less time‚úÖ Significantly increases test coverage. Test Automation allows us to have a look at applications data state and determine if software is behaving as expected.‚úÖ Improves accuracy. Automated Tests follow exactly the same steps each time they are performed and never forget to record detailed results.‚úÖ Handy where manual tests can‚Äôt help. Automated testing can simulate tens, hundreds, or thousands of virtual users interacting with the web, software, and web applications.‚úÖ Helps both developers and testers. Tests can run automatically whenever changes are made to the source code and notify the team or developer if they fail. Such features save developers time and increase their confidence.‚úÖ Helps to improve morale of both development and product team.Completing repetitive tasks with automated software tests gives your team time to complete more difficult and rewarding projects.#endtoendtesting #softwaredevelopmentcompany

MVP is a minimum viable product, a basic version covering the product‚Äôs fundamental components and features targeting the core requirements and needs of end-users. Here are some main benefits of building MVP:üîπ High ROI with low risk. It‚Äôs better to find out what exactly customers desire before giving them the polished and finished product.üîπ Reduce money and time spent on product development. Verify your idea first then build the product.üîπ Get to know the customers as soon as possible. Show your product to your customers as soon as you have some first version of it, get to know them better, recognize their needs.üîπ Finding the early adopters. You really need to know who are the early adopters within your product range (so-called trendsetters)#startup #mvpdevelopment

Why are the largest companies using #ReactNative? React Native components are pure, side-effect-free functions that return what the views look like at any point in time. Famous #apps using React Native :üîπFacebook. Facebook used React Native to #develop its own Ads Manager app, creating both an iOS and an Android version. Both versions were created by the same team of #developers.üîπWalmart. 96% of the codebase was shared between #platforms while the skills and experience of developers were leveraged across the organizationüîπBloomberg. The advantage of React Native is that it automates #code refreshes, accelerating the release of new #product #features.üîπInstagram. 85% to 99% of #code was shared between #Android and #iOS #apps, depending on products.üîπ SoundCloud Pulse. Their experience with the #framework was generally positive. Developers found it easier to work on a React Native-based application than on a native applicationüîπWix. React Native delivered Wix the speed and agility of web app development in the cross-platform space.üîπDelivery.com. React Native allowed the company to connect the map with the device‚Äôs functions like rotate, zoom, and the compass while utilizing less memory and loading faster.

Finding a name for a #mobileapplication becomes more difficult every day, due to the high competition in the market. Picking a name for your app is a complicated, but fascinating process.Pay attention to a few issues:üîπConnect with your audience with a name that creates an emotional return.üîπMake sure to check that your name is easily pronounceable and how it translates into other languages.üîπA play on words can provide you with the perfect #app name.üîπThe name should attract attention, intrigue, and arouse the interest of users.üîπHint at the app‚Äôs functionality. The main purpose of the #mobile #application can already be specified in its name.üîπKeep in mind ASO  (App Store Optimization).üîπBe sure to check whether the name you have invented is available.P.S. Why?This news surprised the public and revived a wave of theories about Satoshi Nakamoto being Steve Jobs.Nakamoto disappeared from the internet on December 12, 2010, Steve Jobs died in 2011. Crypto wallets linked to Nakamoto contain over 1.1 million BTC. "Outsourcing project management usually leads to failure."Well, absolutely not! Let‚Äôs debunk the most widespread myths once and for all, and explore the reasons why outsourcing project management can actually lead to success. üö´The product will be low-quality.‚úÖIn fact, outsourcing project management grants access to a wide talent pool with diverse skills and experiences. This can be especially beneficial for startups and small businesses that may not have the resources to hire a full-time project manager with the necessary expertise. üö´The costs will be higher.‚úÖOutsourcing project management can lead to cost savings since businesses only pay for project management services when needed. This can help reduce fixed costs and improve cash flow (which is, again, critical for startups and small businesses). And because outsourcing gives you access to advanced project management tools and technology, businesses can benefit from them without investing in these tools themselves.üö´Our company won‚Äôt have control over the project.‚úÖBusinesses can maintain oversight and communicate with the team to ensure the project aligns with their goals and objectives. üö´There will be cultural and language barriers.‚úÖWhile there can be barriers when outsourcing project management, these challenges can be mitigated through effective communication and collaboration. Many project management service providers have experience working with businesses from different cultures and can adapt to the specific needs of their clients.So, the next time you hear that outsourcing project management leads to failure, remember that it‚Äôs not always the case. Especially with Lionwood.software! Outsource your project management to us and get access to a fantastic talent pool, and benefit from cost savings, fresh perspectives, and advanced technology solutions. üìàüíª#Outsourcing #ProjectManagement

As a C-level executive, measuring the success of software development projects is my company‚Äôs number-one priority to ensure our work aligns with the clients‚Äô goals and requirements. Here are the most important metrics we track at Lionwood.software:#1. Performance metrics ‚Äì to identify issues in the software that may be affecting UX or overall system performance (such as response time, throughput, and central processing unit [CPU] utilization).#2. Quality metrics ‚Äì to reduce the risk of negative impact on users, identify visual and functional issues (such as supplier performance, software defects, cycle times, and other internal or external features), and minimize the cost of addressing them.#3. Forecast metrics ‚Äì to predict the number of hours needed for different stages of work and foresee negative factors that may significantly impact the product (such as estimated completion time, velocity, lead time, cycle time, backlog size, and work progress).#4. Business value metrics ‚Äì to measure the market value of a software product and ensure that it aligns with the company‚Äôs objectives (such as revenue, profit, customer acquisition, and retention).#5. Project timeline metrics ‚Äì to track progress toward meeting deadlines, including schedule variance, task completion time, and milestone achievement.#6. Code review metrics ‚Äì to measure the number of reviews, fixed defects, and time spent; to identify trends in code quality and areas that may require additional training or resources. #7. Agile process metrics ‚Äì to help developers focus on specific results and business goals, and track progress toward meeting those targets (such as sprint velocity, burn-down rate, and cycle time). #8. Security response metrics ‚Äì to facilitate decision-making and improve performance and accountability through collecting, analyzing, and reporting performance-related data. #9. Size-oriented metrics and function-oriented metrics ‚Äì to measure productivity and quality (such as lines of code and cyclomatic complexity, functionality, and usefulness of the software product).What do I believe is irrelevant to measuring a project‚Äôs success?Calculating developers‚Äô work hours to determine their productivityNumber of fixed bugsNumber of completed tasksEstimating the frequency of code changesMake sure you choose relevant KPIs that align with your development approach. It‚Äôs better to choose fewer KPIs but ensure they are specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound. Regularly review and update your metrics to keep pace with your company‚Äôs objectives. Also, don‚Äôt forget to encourage collaboration. You are measuring the teamwork, after all!These are some proven Lionwood.software practices that might help your business achieve the best results and performance. Do you follow any other actionable tips and metrics to measure the success of your projects? I‚Äôd be happy to learn about them in the comments section.#softwaredevelopment #KPI #productivity

Attention all! As we spend more and more time in front of our computers, it's crucial to maintain a clean and organized workspace and setup. Here's why:1. Improved productivity. A clean and organized workspace can help reduce distractions and increase focus, leading to higher productivity.2. Better health. A cluttered and dirty workspace can increase the risk of illness and allergies.3. Boosted morale. A clean and organized workspace can improve overall mood and create a more positive work environment.4. Professional image. A trashed and cluttered workspace can negatively impact the perception of you and your company.üíª So, tidy up your workspace for a few minutes each day. Your body and mind will thank you! Keep your desk free of clutter, wipe down surfaces, and properly store items when not in use.#setup #workspace #clean #notrash #productivity #work #health #thankyou #environment #help

üí∞ I know that finding the proper startup to invest in is critical to achieving solid returns. But what do venture capitalists look for when evaluating a new startup?1. Strong and experienced leadership. A startup needs a talented and driven team to succeed.2. A clear and compelling business model. A startup should have a clear path to revenue and growth.3. A large and growing market opportunity. A startup should address a significant market need.4. Strong financials. A startup should have a sound financial plan and be able to demonstrate traction.5. A unique and defensible competitive advantage. A startup should have a unique value proposition that sets them apart from the competition.üí° Remember, these are just some key factors that venture capitalists consider when evaluating a startup. But ultimately, it's about finding a team and a business that aligns with your investment thesis and has the potential to generate strong returns.üí∞ The key is to find a business that has the potential to grow and a team that can execute that growth. If you find a startup that meets these criteria, you're well on your way to a successful investment.#startup #business #team #leadership #opportunity #growth #investment

The Future of Digital Marketing: How Web3 is Changing the Game The world of digital marketing is constantly evolving, and the latest development to watch is the emergence of web3. For that unfamiliar, web3 refers to the third generation of the internet, where users have more control over their data and can interact with decentralized applications and services.So, how exactly is web3 changing the world of digital marketing? Here are a few key ways:üîí Decentralized Platforms: Web3 enables the creation of decentralized platforms, where data is stored on a distributed network rather than centralized servers. This allows for more transparency and security in digital marketing and new data analysis opportunities.üí∞ Tokenization: With web3, it's possible to tokenize almost anything, including digital marketing campaigns. This enables brands to reward their customers for their engagement and loyalty, creating a more engaging and rewarding experience for the users.ü§ù Direct Interaction: Web3 allows for direct interaction between brands and customers without intermediaries. Brands can now have a direct and more personalized approach to reaching their target audiences.üí™ New Monetization Models: Web3 opens up new ways of monetizing digital marketing campaigns beyond traditional ads or sponsored content. For example, brands can use tokenized rewards to incentivize actions like social shares or user-generated content.As web3 technologies continue to mature, it's clear that they will play an increasingly important role in the future of digital marketing. Are you ready to take advantage of this game-changing technology? üöÄ#security #technology #experience #digitalmarketing #future #data #web3 #network #engagement #opportunities #opportunities #development #like #content #dataanalysis

Here are some different points to consider when it comes to website accessibility:Accessibility is essential for everyone: By making your website accessible, you can ensure that all users, regardless of their abilities, can access and use it. This includes people with vision, hearing, mobility, and cognitive impairments and those using assistive technologies like screen readers.It can improve the user experience: Making your website accessible can make it easier to use on mobile devices, which can be helpful for users on the go. It can also improve the user experience for all users, not just those with disabilities, by making your website more user-friendly and intuitive.Search engines may give higher rankings to more accessible websites, which can help to improve your website's visibility in search results. This can lead to more traffic and potential customers for your business.Accessibility is a legal requirement: In many countries, some laws require websites to be accessible to people with disabilities. By making your website accessible, you can ensure compliance with these laws and avoid potential legal issues.To learn more about website accessibility, check out Nik P. insights.#business #people #compliance #accessibility¬†#accessibilitymatters¬†#accessibledesign¬†#accessible¬†#userexperience¬†#people¬†#help¬†#compliance¬†#seo¬†#searchengines¬†#webdevelopment¬†#webdesign #divinemedia

I wanted to share my thoughts on the 30-day challenge for visibility on LinkedIn. I think it's not the best strategy to use if you're starting. Even if you want more traction on your page, there are better ways to go about it.First, the pressure to come up with something to post every day can lead to writing many irrelevant things. And on LinkedIn, quality is better than quantity. The kind of content you post will attract a specific audience, so if you're posting about everything under the sun, you'll attract many people who aren't interested in what you have to say.Another thing to consider is that LinkedIn is just a tool for building relationships. The actual results come from developing and nurturing those relationships offline. And more than a 30-day challenge is required to create lasting change. Research suggests it takes an average of 66 days for a new behavior to become ingrained, so what's next after the challenge is over? Will you still have the same energy and drive to continue posting? Will the same people engage with your content during the challenge continue to do so?In my experience, the people who have gotten the best results on LinkedIn didn't start with a 30-day challenge. They focused on building genuine relationships with people, either online or in person. They showed how valuable they are to the other person and built their content around what they do and how they think.So if you're a beginner on LinkedIn, here's what I recommend: instead of posting daily, try publishing one article or short-form text about a topic related to your industry each week. Follow 10 people daily in your industry and outside of it, and use hashtags and the search bar to your advantage. Spend 10 minutes a day looking through your feed, commenting on other people's content, and asking questions.As for the types of content you can create, here are some ideas: "how-to" or list-format posts, questions for your audience, answers to frequently asked questions or objections, predictions about industry trends, lessons learned from your job, and a little personal information.With this strategy, it's easier to be consistent over time, and you'll be able to build genuine relationships and create valuable content. I discuss this in more detail in my book, which will be launched in February 2023. This makes sense and gives you some food for thought!#experience #linkedin #people #share #energy #research #quality #dfytalks¬†#linkedintips

Ukrainian app Obimy took first place in the Lifestyle section of the US App StoreIn August 2022, the Ukrainian app Obimy topped the ranking of the most popular apps in the US App Store in the Lifestyle section, overtaking Tinder, Pinterest, and Netflix. This was reported by representatives of the application development team, AIN.UA reports.It was possible to take first place in the ranking, among other things, thanks to the Obimy update, which took place at the end of July 2022. Firstly, we updated the interface design, and secondly, we reduced the number of clicks to two that need to be made to use the "share feelings" function.The application has expanded the ability of users to apply animation, create their own meanings and describe the mood."If earlier, on average, people sent 2 actions in one" session, then in August - 5. And this figure is growing. Every day, our users send about four million meanings, "commented the developers of Obimy.#ukraine #appdevelopment #webdevelopment

3 Dating App Features that Spark Connections Between Users 1. Gamified User ProfilesBeing at the top of any dating site feature list, a user profile is an essential part of any dating app. It typically contains some basic information, such as gender, age, location, a catchy tagline to show some personality, a list of interests, and a few photos. However, as we have seen with countless dating apps and platforms, basic user profiles alone have minimal impact on user engagement, if at all.Your dating app can go even further by helping your users make their own profiles more interesting and creative in a way that helps their individual personalities shine through.Gamification helps do that. Bumble‚Äôs ideas include adding intriguing questions and conversation starters. And matches that would disappear in 24 hours if the user doesn‚Äôt start a chat with them.Tinder‚Äôs idea is to provide users with a limited number of ‚Äúsuper likes‚Äù that bump their own profile to the top of their super-liked user‚Äôs account. Super likes can even be monetized by giving users the option, or a subscription plan, to purchase more when they run out. 2. In-app Chat and MessagingAlthough text messaging is critical to a dating app, users are hungry for full-featured chat such as voice notes, video messages, image filters. It makes chat less dry and more fun, which helps build better connections between users, increasing the chance of relationships in real life.CometChat offers an in-app chat API fully adaptable to any platform you may use, including¬†VueJS,¬†React,¬†React Native, and more.¬†For images and filters, you can use the¬†Imgix¬†Management API to enable your users to add and manage photos, and the Rendering API to enable image filters.3. Ice breakersEven when a match is made, it doesn‚Äôt mean that users will initiate the first conversation on their own. The reason is, for many people, it can be intimidating to make the first move.¬†This is where ice breakers come in.¬†To get your dating app to succeed and compete with the industry giants in terms of app engagement and retention, you‚Äôll want to give them some easy conversation starters such as trivia and rapid-fire questions to break the ice.

Typical PMS features and functionsThe property management system is software that reminds a computer that can quickly manage the usual functions of the accommodation business. The modules of this software handle different processes such as reservation, operations of the front and back office of the company, channel management, customer communication, housekeeping, and maintenance.Also, there is a division of PMS based on the key functions and features, here it is:Systems for screening the applicants. Such PMS include databases to find the important residents' data.CRM or customer relationship management systems. Their basic purpose is building financial reports, also they offer lease tracking, collection of the rent, and screening of the tenants.Web portals and marketing apps. Give the ability to create the design of real estate websites, and help in lead generation.Property listings. Systems that connect renters with tenants.¬†Short-term rentals management systems. Improve the rental process at different stages.Services and instruments for virtual tours that give the opportunity for real estate owners and managers to upload photos and videos of their property.Contract software for managing legal aspects of renting and buying real estate.Revenue management software for optimizing the price and availability of rooms. Also, this software can predict the behavior of different customer segments. Revenue management systems are common in the hotel business.Speed management systems for centralizing and strengthening the internal control to gain profitability.Software for utility billing and energy management.¬†Payments software that simplifies the rent payment process.Maintenance and lease management software for managing dates of maintenance and financial obligations.Residential community systems for managing the interaction between residents of condo and co-op, members of Home Owners Associations, and others.Workplace management systems for optimizing resources of the workplace. For example, it can be the real estate portfolio.And finally, the global, all-in-one solutions that include everything or almost everything mentioned above.

Though, it is actually true that there is currently no defense in the world against these missiles. Still, there are rather few of them that have been created (some say 30, others 50). Definitely, that is something to consider and we are aware of, but not a game-changing weapon still.russian economy collapses harder and harder, intelligence reports there are already planning to neutralize putin from FSB. Facebook and Instagram are already blocked there, Telegram as well, YouTube will be blocked in a matter of days. They have fewer and fewer ways to know what is happening. Without Chinese support (and they showed already their neutral and even semi-pro-Ukraine position), war will cease within a matter of months. It will still be months of people dying, unfortunately.In the meantime, each Ukrainian man, woman, or kid is waiting for announced last week‚Äôs help in the anti-aircraft weapons. They say some of it already arrived, but yet not all, thus the sky is defacto opened (especially on souther areas where the most latest weapons arrive later).Here is a video about Ukrain current state I wanted to share with you:https://lnkd.in/e5jzTqwEWe are all safe, though I‚Äôm writing this message from a shelter where we‚Äôve hidden because of the air attack alarm which became more often the latest days.

Day 22 of the russian war against Ukraine.Yesterday our president Zelensky made a very powerful speech in front of US Congress yesterday. They all applauded him in the end. Here is a video from it, if you haven‚Äôt seen it:https://lnkd.in/ejFHGDCJAnd as a result, the US announced massive military help, to Ukraine which is expected to significantly change the situation. The main interest there is in anti-aircraft weapons which Ukraine struggled to receive to stop bombings of civil objects. Right after the US, Britain also announced new military help also aimed to protect the sky.Is that not a way to close the sky above Ukraine about which we‚Äôve been asking for 3 weeks now? We think it is. And it is very optimistic. And we‚Äôre very thankful for that, and looking forward to receiving these weapons asap, as it‚Äôs still about 5 kids dying from bombing on average in Ukraine with over 100 have died since start of the war.On the battlefield, there are no significant changes. War is getting to a more slow pace at the moment, there will be sad days still, but that‚Äôs how it is. Ukrainian forces are contra-attacking in some directions and there are a number of battles won in the last couple of days. Significant contra-attacks have been happening around Kyiv yesterday. It was very loud in the city, but this time load from our end. Also huge thanks to the UK embassy, who launched a project to support Ukraine and continue marking it:https://lnkd.in/efdepcr4We are all safe, continue working as normal, being highly organized and back to regular productivity levels, all tasks and calls and meetings and obligations - are as usual.Thank you for staying with
Vladimir Pichkurov #Kudos I just wanted to say #ThankYou

Day 19 of the russian war against Ukraine.We‚Äôre relatively fine. Continue work and being organized, productive, and doing our small and large input into a common victory. We all see russians having issues with supply chains for some time now, and they are getting worse day after day. We do not know the very actual state, and will probably not know it for some time now, but they are reporting a lot of deeply demoralized russian prisoners quite often. Still, it‚Äôs very clear that time is strongly not on their side. We will win, there is just no other option or chance now. The question is still in when will it happen and how many people will get hurt. The situation is very complicated on the Mariupol side at the moment, everything else is stable with occasional contra-attacks from our side. Do you remember I‚Äôve sent a photo of the pregnant women evacuated after the bombing in Mariupol? She and her baby have died yesterday. As of today, it was reported by Mariupol‚Äôs head that for all the blockade days already more than 2500 CIVIL people have died. This is very mean and cruel, and miserable and...You‚Äôve probably heard about bombings 20 km from Poland‚Äôs boarded on international Center for PEACHkeeping and Security where 35 people have died and 134 were wounded. Not having enough resources for direct combat, they take benefit of our weaker air defense and bomb civil objects. This is how they make war. You and everyone should be aware of that, as all guilty will get to the trial. That has happened to german nazi years and years later, this will happen to each and every russian on our territory. We‚Äôre constantly getting air-defense systems and updating them. Yesterday our forces destroyed a column of 50 tanks in south directions and a number of air-crafts in the Kyiv area. We hold all our major positions from the very beginning, including Mariupol, Kharkiv, and Sumu. We effectively continue to push them out. Slowly and effectively.Thank you for believing in Ukraine and our president. Thank you for supporting us. The more support we get - the faster world will get back to a normal state.

Day 14 of the war between russia and Ukraine.Moscow stock exchange did not open again. There are no significant changes on the battlefield, except for severe fights in Mariupol and the fact that russians don‚Äôt allow humanitarian corridors to enter the city (they bomb and shoot them) to deliver food to regular civilians. But the city still stands and does an enormous resistance. They say russians are preparing a ‚Äúlast attempt‚Äù to take Kyiv. We‚Äôre prepared for it. There are already more than 40K international military volunteers who came to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with our soldiers. As there are already about 100% of russian forces inside of Ukraine, they will just not make it to more attempts. Thy sky is still a question, earlier got the message that Poland will give their air jets to enforce the bright-blue sky above Ukraine. Today, I will be short, as there is a lot of work piled up during the long weekend. More of our staff is safe (managed to evacuate developer from Kharkiv over the weekend), we continue working full steam ahead watching russia collapse.

Day 12 of the war between russia and Ukraine.It may sound like it's quiet, but it's not. There are no significant changes, but this current "calm" is not where you would wank to live. Massive bombings in Kharkiv (21 buildings civil were destroyed just yesterday), Mariupol (humanitarian corridor is being bombed and attacked), near Kyiv (severe fights are happening as we speak in Irpen district which used to have elite and very expensive real estate objects and fancy houses), small sweet town Vinnytsia in central Ukraine (8 bombs landed there yesterday).One line about russian economy. Moody's lowered russian rating from B3 to Ca. Lower is only Lebanon and Venezuela. Sorry, one more line, we all are waiting for the Moscow stock exchange market to open (reminding that it has been closed from the very beginning of the war). Once it will open, there going to be a lot of new sad faces in russia. We hope it will open tomorrow. I'm personally back in Lviv. Helping refugees, giving a home to relatives of friends and friends of friends while they search for¬†shelter, taking an active part in cyber resistance (massive and evolving each day DDoS attacks, information campaigns aimed at russians, anti-fake reporting, etc).Today is a day off (we work for it on Saturday this week), tomorrow is a holiday in favor of spring and women. Probably, it will be the saddest 8th of March Ukraine has had in a while. Still, our motivation is high, support is strong, people are firm. I know that you've probably donated already to the Ukrainian either army or the "save a life" fund. I personally donate each day, as a significant part of the country. So I'll just leave it here, in case you feel like it again. Without such people who are helping - we would already lose. In Ukraine we believe.Stepan

React Native - is a JavaScript framework for writing real, natively rendering mobile applications for iOS and Android.	Examples of React Native apps: UberEats, Instagram, Facebook, Walmart, Pinterest, Coinbase, Shopify, Discord.	Pros of React Native- Great companies are already building with React like Tesla, Uber, Facebook, Baidu etc;- Faster to Buil;- One Framework, Multiple PlatformsReact Native allows you to reuse the codebase (or just a part of it) between iOS and Android;- Fast Refresh. This tool fixes all the issues that Hot Reloading has and provides a great developer experience that speeds up both building new features and bug fixing;- Smaller Teams;- Fast Applications;- Simplified UI;- Large developer community;	Cons of React Native- Compatibility & debugging issuesDespite React Native being used by top tech players ‚Äì it‚Äôs still in beta. Your developers might come across various issues with package compatibility or debugging tools.- Lack of Some Custom ModulesLack of some components or underdeveloped. Perhaps you won‚Äôt have a problem with that, as the majority of custom modules you need are available, well-documented, and working properly.- Native Developers Still NeededImplementing some native features and modules necessitates having detailed knowledge of a particular platform.	Which is better: Flutter or React Native?¬†Currently, React Native is more mature and stable - not to mention that it takes advantage of the most popular programming language, JavaScript, and already has a large community of users and supporters behind it. While Flutter is still immature and unstable. #flutter #reactnative #appdevelopment #iosapp #androidapp #webdevelopment

Checklist for App store submissionAdding your app into the stores maybe not be the easiest part and some difficulties can significantly postpone the release.If you want your app submission to go smoothly, you must follow the requirements that the Google Play Store and Apple App Store provide.If you don‚Äôt, the app may be rejected.xn--hecklist-ech for the App Store and Google PlayAPP STORE (iOS):-Unique app name-Icon-Description-Owner‚Äôs name + contact information-Category-Rating-Keywords (tags)-Support for iPhone X Super Retina display-5+ screenshots for iPhone and 5+ for iPad-Information on what‚Äôs new (if submitting a new version)-Support and market URLs-Test account (for review team)-TestFlight beta testingGOOGLE PLAY-Unique app name-Icon (512x512 px)-2‚Äì8 screenshots-Feature graphic (1024x500 px)-Short description-Full description-Content rating-Privacy policy#appstore #googleplay #iosappdevelopment #androidappdevelopment #nativeapps #reactnative

Tech aspects of choosing platform (iOS or Android) Pay attention not only to the geo spread of users but also to main tech details.DesignDesigning an Android app is based on the general flow of Google‚Äôs Material Design Guidelines from which designers use table sizes, icon spacing, color palette recommendations, and many other things.For iOS refer to Apple‚Äôs Human Interface Guidelines. These guidelines are not strict, instead share recommendations for achieving intuitive design. So, Apple‚Äôs guidelines give designers more freedom than Google‚Äôs. Here are 5 main differences between the Material Design Guidelines and Human Interface Guidelines.1 Depth and perception. iOS design prefers to have depth. That means that lines are thin and blurred margins make elements seem to float in their own spaces. Google strictly to material design which looks like sheets of paper.2 Animation. In iOS, it is something with pure utility. It should be simple and discrete. Android wants animations to enhance the user experience and enliven the design.3 Navigation. Apple limits navigation options, making designers think carefully about what functions to include. But this restriction usually leads to comfortable and intuitive designs. Google‚Äôs take on navigation is rather laid back. It can be anywhere. On the one hand, this freedom can boost creativity but on the other can also lead to designs that aren‚Äôt all that user-friendly.4 Buttons. In Android, functional buttons support the Upper case format and are designed to have shadows, while in iOS they are flat and have no shadows. Also, in iOS, there‚Äôs a floating action (call-to-action) button placed in the tab bar. Android‚Äôs analog of the same button is located at the screen‚Äôs bottom-right corner.5 Typography. iOS and Android offer their system fonts. San Francisco is the choice for iOS design and Roboto is for Android. And though basic text sizes are very similar in both platforms, to build text hierarchy, Android mainly uses more white space between texts, while iOS goes with bold type.#iosapp #androidapp #webapp #design

If you have just started thinking about app dev you are probably faced with the main question of which platform to start with. There are several things that can influence the right decision.You won't be surprised that iOS and Android are the two main operating systems nowadays. According to statistic, smartphones running the Android are holding 87% of the global market share, while the market share of smartphones on iOS is 13% only.Based on the geo we will see that iOS is popular in the United States, Canada, Australia, Japan, and Western Europe. Android dominates Central and South America, India, Africa, China, the Middle East, Russia, Eastern Europe, and some other countries.According to Statista numbers in 2021, the Android‚Äôs share in the U.S. market is 43,5% while that of iOS phones accounted for 56,22%. The vice versa situation for Europe, where number of Android users are much higher. (https://lnkd.in/eg6YB4AR)The key point is obvious: go for the operating system that's most popular in your key markets. If your app‚Äôs target audience is in the USA or Canada starts with iOS. If your target based in Eurasia continent (main Europe countries) go with Android platform. This way you will be more successful to get the audience quickly, raise users' numbers and incomes.#iosappdevelopment #androidappdevelopment #startup #uiuxdesign

Societal Drivers of the sharing economy üëê	Increasing the global population increase the total supply demanding. In this case, sharing economy has made life easier for areas with high-density levels. 	- Sustainability	The sharing economy has a positive impact on the environment by reselling or reusing goods. As a result, we achieve avoiding wasted resources and excessive production.	- Enjoyment	Sharing economy platforms include gamification mechanisms that are the same as used in social media apps. So, selling and buying online defined the online entertainment of users.¬†	- Reputation	Supplier's positive or negative reputation defines consumer behavior. Users like being involved in building trust relationships, so checking reviews, making new feedbacks is a usual thing.	- User‚Äìsupplier relationship	Relashiundhips between suppliers and users are a positive influence on customer satisfaction. The main point is that user‚Äìsupplier relationships may also affect consumers' use of sharing economy platforms.	- Network externalities	Network externality it's the value that users receiving from a product or service. Furthermore, despite its own influence its also affects the use of a product or service by other users. The effects of the network were divided into two types:¬†Direct network effects,¬†indirect network effects. Lots of items are affected by the externalities of networks.Many sharing economy platforms using social networks or user recommendations to help others discover new sharing perform at the same time growing users number.#sharingeconomy #iosappdevelopment #mobileappdevelopment #webdevelopment

Customer behavior in the context of sharing platformsPre-purchase stageNeed awareness Clients are searching for new offers when they have a strong need or have a bad experience with the previous service provider, high price, or poor quality.Instead of buying new goods customers prefer using sharing platforms, where you can easily rent or earn money by sharing something.To make the right decision users checking the following info:-Product Brands-Products Variations-Product Quality-Product Alternatives.The key point here is playing information provided based on online reviews and peer ratings, cause it is based on someone's experience. Faced with new sharing platforms users are feeling uncomfortable with new interfaces, hidden taxes, and scammers. The smooth UI and UX helps your users enjoy the app. When the liquidity of the platform increase the more time spend on high-quality matching between provider and users. This can reduce the quality and number of transactions per provider. For example, Li and Netessine empirically demonstrated that as a platform's number of hosts and travelers doubled, search costs (i.e. search friction) increased through an increase of 18.3 percent of inquiries sent to hosts and 19.6 percent to travelers. As a result, traveler confirmation rates dropped by 15.4 percent and host occupancy by 15.9 percent, and the platform lost 5.6 percent of potential transactions due to the increased search friction. Been faced with a huge number of different option user spend a lot of time for search and evaluating the best deal. Spending time and losing selected offers tends to lose users on the platform.To help your users feel comfortable with the searching process platform should include:- filter, sort, compare and rank options, and create customizable search tools and recommendation systems that cater better to individuals' preferences- feedback and rating systems to reduce friction caused by information asymmetry- some specific functions (ex. instant booking function)- online payments#experience #sharingeconomy #users #appdevelopmet

From my personal experience. Living abroad is very useful for your communication skills. When you have to overcome trembling and insurance every time to say something in the store, it helps your resilience a lot. And it also improves your level of English proficiency. When all the movers and almost every salesman speak English well, and no one tells you that you don't speak well enough, no one laughs at you, it helps you feel more confident and smarter than you think you are. When other people call you, who don't see you, you don't have the opportunity to explain to them on your fingers what you want. And for that, you only need to use your own tongue. Therefore, I strongly recommend living abroad for a while if you need more confidence in your English and in your abilities. Because you have no choice, and this situation motivates you very well.#language #english #travelling

How my UI test code has changed after several months of work. Firstly, my locators have become more stable and shorter. I know more ways to write them. Secondly, I use the following scheme:1. Test class. There are only calls with module names here.2. Class in which actions are recorded3. The class of locators.4. I use the Allure annotation for the author and description of the test. I also write a description of each step.5. Thanks to Selenide, I don't use expectations. Selenide itself creates the necessary expectations. (the creator of Selenid @asolntsev is a Ukrainian living in Estonia)6. All tests start by calling the Start function, which initializes the first page.7. All the parameters of the steps are passed to them from the call and the parameters themselves are determined before the test.The photos compare now and before #testing #allure #selenide #testing #qa #autotest #opentowork #java #estonia #progress

The main functions of CRM for a dance school:¬†CRM-system helps to automate routine tasks, control finances, improve customer service and optimize staff performance.üíÉ Accounting for subscriptions in a dance studioThe CRM-system keeps track of visits, controls the duration of season tickets and sends reminders about their renewal. Triggers and robots help to set up the process: a letter to the mail or SMS-message will come automatically to the client.üíÉ Dance school finances controlThanks to the CRM system, keeping financial records becomes simple and convenient. Functions include automatic calculation of income and expenses, generation of reports, as well as control of debts and payments.üíÉ Customer ServiceA CRM system improves interaction with clients and increases service satisfaction. The software provides easy access to information about the school's students, communication history, preferences, and discounts. In addition, the CRM allows you to communicate with clients through various channels, such as online chat on the website, messengers, and social networks in a single portal window. üíÉ Personnel managementThe CRM-system at the dancing school facilitates personnel management, helping to control the working hours, as well as to monitor the productivity and motivation of employees. Each employee can time the work, on a personal kanban-board keep tasks by stages. üíÉ Analytics about the work of the dance schoolCRM-systems for dance schools show data on attendance, popularity of various courses and dance styles, as well as evaluate the effectiveness of marketing activities. CRM - a powerful tool to optimize the dance school. The software provides a comprehensive solution for subscription accounting, financial control, customer service, personnel management and analytics about the school.#itach #bitrix24 #crm #automatization #marketing #work #data #workinghours #motivation #communication #management #help #productivity #students #analytics #accounting #software #robots #payments #school #customerservice #kanban #finances #schools

Why does an advertising agency need a CRM system?In today's competitive marketing world with demanding clients, advertising agencies need a tool that helps them stay one step ahead of the market and produce a wow effect. All the information you've shared with your client over the course of the partnership is available in the software. Active selles is a method of communication with the client, where the main initiative is the seller.The main task is to make a presentation of the product so that the person thinks that he himself decided to buy the product. This requires an open dialogue, empathy, listening carefully to the interlocutor and discussing his needs.There are a few rules to help make sales more successful:‚úî Initiate a dialogue with the customer. The interlocutor should participate in the conversation, not just listen to a speech about the benefits of the product.‚úî Ask questions - open-ended, with "yes" and "no" options, alternatives with multiple choice options.‚úî Apply active listening techniques. When the customer speaks, nod your head and show the interlocutor that you are listening.‚úî Sell in the customer's world. Present the product in terms of benefits and values specifically to your customer.‚úî Don't drag out the presentation. Don't overload the customer with information. All he needs to hear is the benefits that will solve his problem in order to make a decision.‚úî Don't argue. Even if the customer raises objections, let him know that you accept his point of view.‚úî Leave the right of refusal. Don't pressure the customer if they don't agree to the purchase, but thank them and offer to come back when you need help.In the process of presenting the product, answer the questions:‚ùó How this product improves life.‚ùó How is it better than other similar products.‚ùó Why it is better to buy now.‚ùó What guarantees the customer will receive.In active sales, the salesperson takes the initiative. They can take place over the phone, on the Internet, in person, or at a business event. Sales are divided into five stages: making contact, identifying needs, presenting the product with the customer's pains in mind, working off objections and the transaction. After the purchase, it is necessary to exchange contacts with the customer and say goodbye politely.#itachsoft #bitrix24 #crm #automatization #sales #business #help #event #communication #empathy

To manage your business and make strategic decisions, you need to immerse yourself in your processes and be aware of your performance.¬†That's where CRM, a multifunctional tool for working with customers and employees, comes in. There are many analysis tools available in CRM. The main features of the systems are:‚úî Sales data management. You'll be able to track the dynamics and all stages of a transaction - from customer visits to payment and delivery. This helps you evaluate the effectiveness of your marketing strategy, the seasonality of demand, and the speed with which customers move through the sales funnel.‚úî Customer research. CRM helps identify the needs and behavioural patterns of loyal customers, build a financial rating and segment the customer base. This information helps to identify popular and unclaimed products and to adjust advertising campaigns.‚úî Performance Evaluation. The program generates reports for each manager and department. You can encourage productive employees and work with those who make mistakes.‚úî Monitoring of calls and advertising sources. You will know at what time clients are most active, and distribute the load on your staff, determine promising promotion channels, audience involvement, conversion of leads into sales.‚úî Sales funnel analysis. The software builds the funnel and displays the number of leads at each stage. With the help of the metric you will learn at which stages deals are more likely to fail, you will be able to understand the reasons and revise your sales strategy.As a result, with CRM analytics, your business will get rid of unnecessary costs, focus on the most profitable audience segments and choose effective advertising channels. #itachsoft #bitrix24 #automatization #crm #sales #business #research #work #strategy #advertising #analytics #marketingstrategy #help #datamanagement #software #stage

We often repeat that the IT industry is immature. One of the reasons is its current chaotic qualification system.Engineers call themselves junior, middle, or senior depending on their skills. The problem is, those skills would be different from company to company. It creates uncertainty in both engineers and companies. The companies don't know who they are hiring as middle engineers. And engineers don't know if the projects' tasks will be of the right complexity for them.To speed up the development of the IT industry, we need a transparent standard qualification model across the whole IT industry. That way,‚≠êÔ∏è Engineers will grow their skillset faster.‚≠êÔ∏è Companies will recruit engineers with the right skills.‚≠êÔ∏è Clients will trust the IT industry.Syberry does its part in standardizing how we view qualifications in IT. We have our own qualification model built as a web app. The model lists all skills necessary for different qualifications from an intern in software engineering to a senior QA manager.We described the skills together with recommended theory and competency areas. When an engineer masters a skill, they can submit evidence of it, prove their qualification, and grow. In Syberry, we know for sure what a middle or a senior engineer means.How does growth in qualification work in your company?

Good day, Dear Friends!Theme #3. Approaches to IT product development: Waterfall and Agile.Short.Waterfall is a tough, consistent approach to IT product development.Pros:1. Development is limited by budget and time;2. A clear plan and detailed documentation. Requirements are not changed;3. Long-term development planning;4. Calm and moderate development atmosphere.Cons:1. Weak communications with the customer: the customer can not influence on anything during the development process;2. IT product is not developed in a flexible way: changes are not accepted. The functionality is not improved at the development stage ‚Äì poor adaptability to market changes;3. Testing at the last stage of development ‚Äì a high risk of finding a mass of accumulated bugs, and as a result, a forced release delay;4. An IT product enters the market when it is completely ready:- they waited a long time and no one needs it anymore, because it was needed yesterday;- competitors are ahead of us and there are many of them.Agile is a soft, flexible approach to IT product development.Pros:1. Entering the market at an early stage ‚Äì MVP;2. Daily work on the IT product together with the —Åustomer;3. Requirements are able to be changed at any stage of development ‚Äì the flexibility of an IT product on the market. The functionality is constantly being developed and improved;4. Self-organization and initiative: everyone can initiate any solution for the benefit of an IT product.Cons:1. Impossible to calculate budget and timeline: requirements are constantly being changed;2. Constant changes can negatively influence on the final quality of the IT product;3. Constant changes demotivate the team: needs to work additionally on the psychological state and motivation of the team.Waterfall or Agile ‚Äì You choose.See you later!P.S. Good day, Dear Friends!My last post was about Theme #1. IT product management. Introduction.Short and In simple words. Left the link in P.S.This time, I want to tell you about the process of the birth of an IT product, the so-called MVP stage.Theme #2. The birth of an IT product ‚Äì MVP.MVP (Minimum Viable Product) is a test IT product, with a minimum and fundamental set of functions or one single function.The purpose of MVP is to check the viability and relevance of the created IT product on the market.At the MVP stage, the Product Manager receives feedback from the target audience and understands if it is worth developing the IT product further or abandoning the plan, what changes should be made and what should be left as it is.MVP is divided by creation methods, the main ones are:1. MVP Landing Page.An IT product is presented as a landing page.The page contains a description of the product, information about benefits, there is a dialogue with a potential user, and at the end, a "Registeration" button is added in order to receive news about this product by e-mail.The landing page allows you to evaluate the interest in the product, collect a subscriber base, and further develop a dialogue with them.2. MVP Concierge.All operations are carried out manually by the product development team, just like the Concierge does in a hotel.In order not to develop an application, to spend money and time on it, you can become this application by yourself, at the first stage. In a such a way, you will evaluate the demand and feedback, get the experience of live communication with the user.3. MVP Wizard of Oz.An IT product has a shell, for example a website, but all operations are carried out by the development team also manually, veiled. You create an illusion of artificial intelligence for the user, like a Wizard.The Wizard of Oz allows not only to test the idea, to save on the development of automated functionality, but also to find out if the site, the shell is designed correctly, from the user's point of view, what conveniences and inconveniences are created.4. MVP One function.An IT product is presented in the form of a single function, a Unique Selling Proposition (USP), most often, and designed as a mobile or web application, a bot, for example.Usually created for investors to show if an idea will work or not.5. MVP Pre-order.The description of the future IT product is placed on a crowdfunding platform, interest is analyzed, funds and first users are raised.That's it. üòä  The MVP stage is very important. Competently leading of this stage allows you to evaluate the idea, correctly, avoid a lot of mistakes, financial losses, launch a cool IT product for yourself and people to enjoy.See you later!P.S. https://lnkd.in/d9C2XBmp#WhatIsITShortAndInSimpleWords#it¬†#itproductmanagement

Good day, Dear Friends!My name is Arkadiy Arustamov.I work in IT. I am an IT Product Developer.And very often I hear from different people:- IT is a very difficult- IT is incomprehensible words- IT is only coding and computers, buttons and irons- IT is a very closed and strange people- etc.By this reason, I will try to explain to the people, from my side, What is IT? Short and In simple words, without going deep but without losing the essence. The information will be averaged, compressed and provided in portions so that it is easy to digest. And maybe some of you will be able to look at IT from a different angle and even join to this interesting direction. And for some of you, who are already familiar with IT, it will be an interesting article to learn something new or share the experience.I start with IT Product Management.What is IT? Short and In simple words.Theme #1. IT Product Management. Introduction.IT Product Management ‚Äì is the process of inventing, planning, creating, launching, supporting and improving of IT product.Mainly, IT products divide into 3 types:1. B2C product.A product created to meet the demand of ordinary people.For example, a company creates a messenger, so that people can communicate with each other, share photos and videos.2. B2B product.A product created by one company for the needs of another company.For example, a company creates a corporate messenger and sells it to other company for its corporate needs with full product support.3. Internal product.A product created for the internal needs of the company.For example, a company creates its own corporate messenger for the convenience and security of employee communication.IT products also divide into 3 versions of development, mainly:1. Mobile application2. Web application3. Bot (gain popularity)Product Manager ‚Äì is the Hero of this process. He is responsible for creating and prosperity of IT product. This is a very versatile person, who can speak the same language with both business and technical specialists. He manages an IT product.Developing a product, Product Manager, by agreement with the team, uses one of the following most popular development methodologies:1. Scrum (Agile)2. Kanban (Agile)3. WaterfallFor the purpose of product management, depend on a product and a company, Product Manager cooperates with 2 teams, mainly:1. Business teamFounders, Sales, Marketing, Project Managers (business), Lawyers, Customer support service, Business analysts, etc.2. Technical teamUX/UI Designers, Project Managers (development), Fronted Developers, Backend Developers, Integration and Operation Developers, Quality Assurance Developers, etc.Product Manager and his team coordinate and make decisions, the purpose of which is the successful formation, growth and development of the product.Yes, yes... Such a universal person should be... And such an interesting job he has üòâSee you later!#WhatIsITShortAndInSimpleWords#it

Hi everyone üëãüèºClients or partners?I'd like to share my opinion about the differences between these concepts with you. I'll tell you a story from my experience, and maybe it will help someone.Clients and partners should become identical in terms of perception.From my own experience and the experience of many other business owners, it became clear that long-term relationships are better than short-term ones. Long-term relationships are always built on honesty and trust, and trust is a partnership. One cannot exist without the other, like a plane without an engine. The client does not always trust the seller. He is looking for a catch, trying to catch a lie, while the partner knows: we are driving in the same car, and both will suffer if a collision happens.Speaking of this, I recall one story.The client's manager, let's call her Sophie, came with a request for a website redesign. The client cannot take a step forward and start for a long time. We hop on the project, made the new design, and everything was fine. We were waiting for the confirmation for development. Sophie shared that the client doesn't let the project to move on to the next steps. I asked several questions, the answers to which led to one single conclusion: the need to make a website is not always the true desire. If they wanted to, they would have already done it. I suggested Sophie to leave this project, and in the end, she did just that. Yes, our profit was exactly zero but read to the end.After some time, Sophie returned to us for cooperation with several other projects, which we did not expect. So, ordinary honesty made a partner out of a client.Thanks for reading to the end.üë®üèº‚Äçüíª #businessowners #design #experience #help #project

Hi everyone!¬†üëãüèºToday I‚Äôd like to share with you a recommendation from The Art of Systems Thinking by Joseph O'Connor & Ian McDermott.It introduces the idea that a system has properties created by the system itself. If we are talking about a team of employees in a company, then the property of the team is not inherent in each employee, it is located between them.You may ask yourself right now: ‚ÄúWhy do I need to know this?‚Äù To know one thing: there are no productive and unproductive employees - there is a system in which they manifest themselves in one way or another. When creating your company, you need to work on this, and then the people who come to work with you will show their best qualities: creativity, determination, and purposefulness. Now that there is a debate about whether or not working remotely affects the team, I have an answer that is based on this book and was discovered by me even before the pandemic - it all depends on the system you are building.I'll leave a link to Amazon here if you're interested in reading this book.https://lnkd.in/efP82-N7

üèôÔ∏è The concrete jungle had come to life‚Ä¶A month ago, I found myself in the bustling heart of New York City, blessed with a single day of pure beauty. Think back to 2017, when at the age of 17, I was just about to take my first steps into entrepreneurship. Back then, the city felt like nothing but a cold, concrete jungle devoid of charm.Now, six years later, my latest NYC trip felt like a breath of fresh 'entrepreneurial' air. During these years, I've learned how to thrive under pressure, plan for the unknown, and envision a brighter future even in the darkest times. This time around, the city revealed itself as a vibrant, man-made marvel. In 2017, I saw a soulless metropolis plagued with urban issues. In 2023, I witnessed the power of dreams, felt the pulse of millions of lives, and embraced the city's rich, sometimes painful, history. The concrete jungle had come to life, and it was truly beautiful.Above all, this trip highlighted how much my entrepreneurial perspective has evolved, and just how much I've come to admire the spirit of innovation.

About a year ago, I returned home to Ukraine after attending my graduation at Georgetown. Despite the ongoing war, I was eager to be with my family and delve back into our wartime routine. As I was unpacking my suitcases, one call became a turning point in my life.I was accepted into the Stanford University Graduate School of Business MBA program - an extraordinary hub where innovation and impact intertwine like nowhere else. Remarkably, I had submitted my application from a bomb shelter, seeking refuge. Since that moment, our team at Movadex has expanded, and we've extended our non-profit efforts through Globi, an initiative aimed at fostering positive change in war-torn areas, not just in Ukraine, but worldwide.Navigating the pandemic and the turbulence of war has taught me resilience and determination. Today, I am profoundly honored and humbled to announce that I will be joining Stanford as a Knight-Hennessy Scholar. I could never have foreseen this incredible journey, but I acknowledge the tremendous opportunity and responsibility that comes with it. Having witnessed the horrors of war firsthand, I am committed to using my skills and knowledge to create a positive impact on communities around the globe.My deepest gratitude goes to my family, friends, colleagues, Georgetown University, Stanford University Graduate School of Business, and the inspiring Knight-Hennessy Scholars community. With their unwavering support and guidance, I believe anything is possible. I am beyond thrilled to embark on this new adventure, joining forces with fellow scholars to catalyze significant change and inspire hope, transcending boundaries and uniting generations.
