Glory to the hero‚Ä¶

When I think back to the early days of my entrepreneurial journey, I am filled with gratitude for the mentors who paved the way for me. As a young female entrepreneur from Ukraine, participating in a Georgetown Entrepreneurship and Ukraine Global Scholars, I was lucky enough to cross paths with a group of remarkable leaders who saw potential in me and took me under their wing.They shared their wisdom, knowledge, and experience with me, guiding through the ups and downs of brining your idea into reality and giving me the confidence to pursue my own goals. I will always be grateful for their unwavering belief in me and generosity in sharing their time and expertise.Fast forward to today, as a co-founder of Movadex and social innovator, I understand the value of mentorship all too well. Working with my talented colleagues at Movadex has taught me the importance of education and support in fostering growth and resilience. We quickly realized that hiring full-time mentors wasn't feasible for our startup, so we got creative. We brought on part-time mentors to support our team, and the results were phenomenal - increased job satisfaction, performance, and retention.However, finding the right mentor for each team member is no easy feat. Our recruitment team worked tirelessly to carefully vet and interview each candidate, ensuring they were the perfect fit for our team. The investment in mentorship was a game-changer for our company, but not every organization has the capacity to do so. I recently met Connie Liu, Stanford University Graduate School of Business MBA graduate and founder of Tandem, which makes matching teams with mentors easy. They find you the perfect fit mentors for all your employees and a structure for great learning to happen. I wish we had Tandem when we were starting out so we didn‚Äôt have to build it all from scratch!I've joined Tandem as a mentor and I am eager to share my own experiences and help others grow. I am grateful for the mentors who have supported me and I am excited to give it forward and help others find their own path to making an impact in this world.
Prayers and condolences to all the families‚Ä¶

Our family's close friend is fundraising to purchase UAV drone for our brave soldiers on the frontline. Michael is an American citizen, who emigrated from Ukraine 20 years ago. But as the war started, he volunteered to join our forces in hopes that his children will one day enjoy a peaceful sky in his home country. They are currently fighting in Bakhmut, which as many Ukrainians know became a true hell on earth and where intensified fighting continues nonstop. Micheal's sister spent last year organising humanitarian aid and protective armor for soldiers and refugees and now has joined other volunteers in fundraising for the drone. You can make your donation via PayPal - tretyakhanna@gmail.com, via Zelle (773 590 9933) or Venmo (Zoryana-Yavorski). Thank you in advance for your consideration and help! üá∫üá¶Photo on the right was taken this winter, when Zoriana, his sister, visited Michael away from the fighting zone for his only rest period of one week since February 24th.

This is üá∫üá¶ Maria Donchenko üá∫üá¶ and her cutie, Molly. They are in what used to be our bright and energetic office in Lviv. Despite all the horror and pain, Maria, like every other Ukrainian, remains strong and resilient, she continues to live. I remember the fear of the unknown during the first major power off. We had no water, no heat, no network, no light. And even then, we remained strong. From reaction to action, we placed an order for Starlink and a power generator unit so that we could keep Movadex heart beating. I urge you to imagine for a moment, being in a beautiful capital of Ukraine ‚Äì Kyiv. This time of the year has its own magic and charm...But this year is different. I‚Äôm sure by now you have seen the new National Christmas tree in Ukraine. Imagine sitting in the comfort of your home, with warm water, with Wi-Fi, with all the kitchen and bathroom appliances, with a Christmas tree that you decorated together with your family. Now, imagine all of that gone for a few days. Seems like the Apocalypse. Imagine that this is not a one-time occurrence, but your new daily routine. Imagine living, working, eating, talking, breathing in these conditions. Imagine waking up on Dec 19th from a sound of explosion. Dec 19th is celebrated by many in Ukraine. On this day, children receive gifts from St. Nicholas in the morning. Imagine having your kid wake up due to the sound of Shahed-136! It was only last night that you were impatiently waiting to see their happiness from all the Christmas gifts in the morning. For a moment, imagine surviving in that reality. Are we really humans after letting this continue for 300 DAYS?!

This is a very special cake üç∞To begin with, this is the 3rd cake I ever cooked in my life. I am as far from cooking and baking as it gets. But, ever since I got back to my home in Kyiv last month, I started to use all the bare minimum cooking skills I have to treat my family with something I made myself. Why I do that:1) It‚Äôs magical to me‚ú® Mostly, in reality, it‚Äôs chemistry, but given my lack of knowledge in that field - looks like magic to me. I turn seemingly unrelated ingredients into a dish, at times even a delicious one. This teaches me that with practice and passion, I can make things work regardless of the first impression and disbelief. 2) I disconnect from reality. I read news non-stop. Hardly impossible not to when you live in wartime. Today was yet another very painful day for Ukraine. While I cook, I dedicate my whole self to the process. And for a short period of time - no news, no TV, no chaos. 3) I feel and share joy. Now, given my inner critic, that heavily depends on whether I end up liking the taste of the dish I prepared. This very cake in the photo, though visually not perfect, passed the taste check and I could share it with my family and neighbors.4) Speaking of perfect, this cake is all but perfect. The process wasn‚Äôt all as smooth as it was promised in the recipe. I did not look like the chef in the YouTube video and nor did my messy kitchen. I added too much vanilla and forgot a key ingredient, and‚Ä¶. I used whipped cream for decoration. So two lessons from this one: nothing is perfect and yet it‚Äôs still amazing, and don‚Äôt use whipped cream to decorate your cake - it‚Äôs a shortcut, but a very temporary one üò©Original recipe said it would take 60-90 minutes. I spent almost 200 and enjoyed all of them. And if I may, let this post be a reminder that war in Ukraine is still ongoing. We keep our spirits strong even when it seems impossible like after news today. Please, continue to stand with and support Ukraine üíôüíõ

Wow‚Ä¶the places that my dreams take me ‚ù§Ô∏èI am thrilled to share that I got accepted into Stanford University Graduate School of Business MBA Class of 2025!War shook up my reality and put me into an autopilot state of mind. Floundering in a swamp of confusion, desperation, and anxiety, it hit me early in April: I‚Äôve always dreamt of being an MBA student, starting a social entrepreneurship endeavor at Stanford in sunny California!‚òÄÔ∏è That sunshine reached my home and quickly drained the swamp I was trapped in. It also hit me that the deadline for my application was approaching‚Ä¶With the help of my dear mentors and professors, I was able to hit the submit button on April 12th at midnight Kyiv time. A few weeks later, I flew to Hilltop to complete my undergrad adventure at Georgetown University McDonough School of Business.In less than a month before my graduation, I had one of the most inspiring interviews with GSB alumna and speed-prepped for GMAT. Scoring the bare minimum of 650 weakened my morale and yet left my hopes unscathed.On May 25th, I crossed the Poland-Ukraine border rushing to meet my family after 42-hour transatlantic trip. The moment my husband and I entered our home with luggage in our hands, my phone suddenly rang. In about 10 seconds after picking up, I burst into tears as I heard Wil Torres congratulating me on getting into Stanford!!!This application process, along with everything that‚Äôs been going on back home in Ukraine and in my life, taught me something:My dreams, but most importantly being loyal to them, truly take me places üöÄThis journey was eye-opening, inspiring, and transformative and I am forever thankful to the Stanford GSB Admissions team for the opportunity and phenomenal support throughout the process. Special thanks to Christine Friedman, Valeria Wiens, Monica Ferguson, üá∫üá¶Irra Ariella Khi - ZAMNAüá∫üá¶, Monica Maxwell-Paegle, Sarah Gershman.I can‚Äôt wait to join the Stanford community and grow both personally and professionally to propel a better future for the communities I serve. I also look forward to growing our operations at Movadex and transforming our support activities for Ukraine into social impact platform. üåüDream big!üåü#stanfordgsb

Three months ago, Ukrainian Parliament Member Kira Rudik was fighting for animal rights legislation. Now, she‚Äôs wielding a rifle to fight for the future of her country.Rudik attended the Executive Program in Women‚Äôs Leadership at Stanford GSB in 2018. The following year, she was elected to parliament after the IT company she helped run, Ring Ukraine, sold to Amazon. The same energy that drove her business success is now helping secure international support and armaments for Ukraine.While many of her fellow citizens fled to safe zones, Rudik says, ‚ÄúI felt I could do more to help by staying here.‚Äù Early in the conflict, that meant keeping people alive. As fighting moved eastward, Rudik says she‚Äôs ‚Äúback to being a political leader rather than being just a spare fighter with a gun.‚ÄùDespite the chaos of the invasion, Rudik says organizations are now in place to bring some level of order. ‚ÄúMy government ID was a huge deal because I was able to get people to listen while organizing refugee transportation or bomb shelters,‚Äù she says.Thinking about freedom, Rudik says her perspective has totally changed. ‚ÄúI know exactly what it means,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúWhen I stand under the Ukrainian flag, I think about how many people paid with their lives so that we can keep that flag hanging.‚Äù https://lnkd.in/gpwacriZ

Co-founding Movadex, getting married, living through Covid-19 and war in Ukraine‚Ä¶I look back at my 4 years at Georgetown University and think to myself, It was a hell of a ride!‚Ä¶the kind of ride I couldn‚Äôt even think of at the age of 15 when I was exploring my dream schools with Yuliya Sychikova.The first big win had come as I left my home in Kyiv and set sail for an all-girls Emma Willard School in Troy, NY. Uncovering my entrepreneurial spirit, I was helping 5 local companies that inspired me to envision how I could be part of something big.Becoming a Hoya at Georgetown in 2018 was big enough as you can imagine.In my first year, I had to adjust my study routine to socialising obligations on my freshman floor. Frankly, I kept getting better at academics, networking, and all-nighters, thanks to creativity and resilience (and a little bit of caffeine) that kindled in me as I immersed myself in a life-changing curriculum and entrepreneurship initiatives at Georgetown University McDonough School of Business.¬†I was building up the drive, energy, and resources that I directed into entering the digital services industry. In my sleepless and life-changing freshman year, Movadex came true. Together with my co-founder üá∫üá¶ Nor Newman üá∫üá¶, we created a dream team that provides design and development services to startups and enterprises globally.Covid-19 hit in my sophomore year showing me that caffeine might not work this time but creativity instilled in every Hoya sure could‚Ä¶, and it did. Trapped in my home back in Kyiv, my team and I continued to grow, helping companies stay in the game even during the lockdown. In the following two years, I switched to a remote work/study mode, successfully managing my business classes, growing Movadex to 35 full-time members, and cherishing my personal life. Just a few months ago I married the kindest, most loving, and hard-working man Bohdan Struk ‚ù§Ô∏èMy hope for brighter future grew stronger and died the moment I woke up from airstrikes on February 24th. Russia invaded Ukraine.Sleepless nights, panic attacks, crying for hours, and shattered hope were enough to bring me down as I was watching my country and people being viciously murdered. But I got up and fought in every way I could, for my country, for freedom, for the future of Movadex. We carried out our work from bomb shelters, supporting the army and refugees while flawlessly managing existing and new projects. We persevered.A few weeks ago, I came back to Hilltop, thinking to myself:It was a hell of a ride‚Ä¶but I am here.The ride isn‚Äôt over. There is a war to win, and a country to rebuild. As I was proudly holding the Ukrainian flag in front of thousands of people far away from home during senior convocation, my hope for a brighter future resurrected because Hoyas never really lose hope. They keep fighting until victory comes. Hoya Saxa üéì and Slava Ukraini üá∫üá¶#HoyaSaxa #georgetown #graduation #standwithukraine

According to TechJury, VR stats for 2021 show that VR adoption in e-commerce can boost online shopping conversion by 17%. Yet, only 1% of retailers currently use VR (or AR) in their customer buying experience.That made many industries take notice but not rush into taking advantage of VR's immersive capabilities. Yet, here are some industries where VR is making a significant impact today:üî∏ Tourism. E.g., Air France and Virgin Airlines want to regularly offer VR headsets as a new type of in-flight entertainment.üî∏ Automobile. E.g., BMW uses VR as a way to experience detailed photo-realistic renderings of their cars.üî∏ Finance. E.g., Salesforce and Fidelity use Oculus Rift VR headsets to showcase immersive 3D data representations and visualize the ebbs and flows of the investment portfolios.üî∏ Fashion. E.g., Dior and Topshop have teamed up with Oculus to deliver unprecedented runway access. More so, Dior even created their VR headset, Dior Eyes.VR is becoming more accessible and affordable each year. With adoption rates going the way they are, the price will continue to go down, as lead VR companies like Oculus and HTC are perfecting their immersive experience. Thus, more industries are waking up to VR's potential.For more examples of how VR can revolutionize almost any business, check the following article: https://lnkd.in/eazRDvkP#vr #virtualreality #simulators #ar #business #app #application

Products created by the company have been introduced in more than 40 banks of Ukraine. ‚óº Project goals: - The DL Agency team faced the task of redesigning the Lime Systems website. - The new design was supposed to symbolize the modernity, technology and convenience of banking products. - The client's desire was to surprise and attract new users, while conveying to them a large amount of information about products and services in a simple and understandable form. ‚óº Result:  - The main page is made on a dark background, it is bright and dynamic, with interesting animation. Brand colors are used with glow and blur. - The main target audience is managers of the banking sector who value clarity, clarity and comprehensibility. Therefore, the internal pages of the site are made on a white background, and color accents and graphic elements are used minimally, so as not to distract attention and simplify the perception of a large amount of content. - Lime Systems currently has 11 products that are hard to visualize because they are software. Therefore, DL Agency has developed unique abstract illustrations with its own color for each product. Such a solution helps users easily distinguish between products and navigate in them. - The product pages are also distinguished by the fact that they contain the interfaces of each software in the form of illustrative screenshots.  ‚óæ Market: Ukraine  ‚óæ Niche: SaaS ‚óæ Period: Feb 2021  Web Design and Development Analytics UI/UX https://lnkd.in/dH5gwqXN #DL #dlAgency #webdevelopment #webdesign #ui #ux #uiux #ai #artificialintelligence #banking #digital #IT #software #technology #userinterface #LimeSystems

I spent most of my career working for big corporations. In 2015 I moved to Germany together with my husband, and two kids 13 and 5 years old. So exactly 7 years ago. Being an immigrant and female, after the relocation I lost my career and had to start in Germany almost from scratch.After 7 years, I found myself essentially in the same position I had started in. I was making more money than when I had started but not near what I was worth.In 2020 I applied for the Kellogg-WHU EMBA program and got admitted! This was a life-changing journey that is not finished yet!5 months ago, I asked my manager for a road map. I wanted to know what it would take to get me to the next level both in title and responsibility as well as salary. I never got the roadmap. But what I did get was a harsh lesson. Sometimes no matter how hard you work or how much you contribute, it may never be worthy of recognition.At this point, I realized:¬†I was tired of pushing myself. I was tired of not being valued. So I gave my 3 months notice.https://lnkd.in/e4vQ9KC2#startups #listerly #elenatsemirava #womenentrepreneurs

Cash Management System in Healthcare: Ensuring Financial Stability and EfficiencyIn the fast-paced world of healthcare, managing finances can be a complex and daunting task. A robust cash management system is essential for healthcare organizations to optimize financial processes, reduce fraud, and improve overall efficiency. In this article, we will explore the benefits of cash management systems in healthcare and discuss how they contribute to ensuring financial stability and efficiency. Cash management in healthcare involves handling, tracking, and optimizing the flow of funds within the organization. A cash management system helps healthcare providers efficiently manage their revenue cycle, payments, and cash flow, ensuring financial stability and sustainability.Benefits of Cash Management Systems in Healthcare1.	Streamlined Revenue Cycle Management: A cash management system helps healthcare organizations effectively manage their revenue cycle, from patient registration and billing to collections and reimbursement, ultimately improving cash flow and financial performance.2.	Reduced Fraud and Errors: By automating and streamlining financial processes, cash management systems can help reduce the risk of fraud and errors, ensuring that funds are handled securely and accurately.3.	Improved Financial Reporting and Analysis: Cash management systems provide healthcare organizations with access to real-time financial data and analytics, enabling them to make informed decisions and identify opportunities for improvement.4.	Enhanced Patient Experience: Cash management systems can help healthcare providers deliver a more seamless and convenient patient experience by automating billing and payment processes, ultimately improving patient satisfaction.5.	Cost Savings: Implementing a cash management system can help healthcare organizations identify inefficiencies, reduce administrative costs, and optimize financial processes, ultimately leading to cost savings and improved financial performance.As cash management technology advances, we can expect to see even more innovative features and solutions in healthcare. Integrating cash management systems with other emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence (AI) and blockchain, could further enhance financial management and streamline healthcare processes.A robust cash management system is essential for healthcare organizations to ensure financial stability and efficiency. By embracing the potential of cash management systems, healthcare organizations can optimize financial processes, reduce fraud, and improve overall efficiency, ultimately contributing to a more sustainable and patient-centric healthcare system. The future of healthcare will likely see an increased focus on cash management solutions as they continue to drive innovation and enhance financial performance. #CashManagement #HealthcareFinance

IoT Solutions in Healthcare: Connecting Patients, Providers, and DevicesThe Internet of Things (IoT) has made significant strides in recent years, enabling seamless connectivity between devices, systems, and users. In healthcare, IoT solutions are creating a connected ecosystem that has the potential to improve patient care and streamline operations. In this article, we will discover the power of IoT in healthcare and explore how this technology enables a more connected and efficient healthcare system. IoT in healthcare refers to the interconnection of various medical devices, sensors, and software applications that work together to collect, transmit, and analyze patient data. By leveraging the power of IoT, healthcare providers can monitor patient health in real-time, streamline communication, and enhance overall patient care.Benefits of IoT Solutions in Healthcare1.	Remote Patient Monitoring: IoT-enabled devices, such as wearables and implantable sensors, can monitor patients' vital signs and other health parameters, allowing healthcare providers to track their condition remotely and intervene when necessary.2.	Enhanced Patient Care: IoT solutions can help healthcare providers deliver personalized care by using data from connected devices to inform treatment decisions and optimize care plans.3.	Improved Operational Efficiency: IoT can streamline healthcare operations by automating routine tasks, such as inventory management and patient registration, freeing up staff to focus on patient care.4.	Data-Driven Decision Making: By collecting and analyzing data from IoT devices, healthcare providers can make more informed decisions regarding patient care, resource allocation, and overall performance.5.	Cost Savings: IoT solutions can help healthcare providers reduce costs by minimizing hospital readmissions, improving patient outcomes, and automating routine tasks.As IoT technology advances, we can expect to see even more innovative features and solutions in healthcare. Integrating IoT with other emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence (AI) and blockchain, could further enhance patient care and streamline healthcare processes.IoT solutions in healthcare have the potential to transform the industry by connecting patients, providers, and devices in a seamless ecosystem that improves patient care and streamlines operations. By embracing the potential of IoT, healthcare organizations can create a more patient-centric healthcare system that prioritizes patient engagement and overall satisfaction. The future of healthcare will likely see an increased focus on IoT solutions as they continue to drive innovation and enhance patient outcomes. #IoT #HealthcareTech

AI and Machine Learning Solutions in Healthcare: Transforming Diagnosis and TreatmentArtificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) have experienced rapid growth in recent years, and their potential applications in healthcare are vast and transformative. AI and ML are revolutionizing how healthcare providers diagnose and treat various conditions, from predicting patient outcomes to personalizing treatment plans. This article will explore the impact of AI and machine learning solutions in healthcare and discuss their potential to transform diagnosis and treatment.AI and ML technologies use algorithms to analyze vast amounts of data, learn from it, and make predictions or recommendations based on the patterns and trends they identify. In healthcare, AI and ML can be applied to various areas, such as diagnostics, treatment planning, and patient monitoring, to enhance the quality of care and improve patient outcomes.Benefits of AI and Machine Learning Solutions in Healthcare1.	Improved Diagnostics: AI and ML can help healthcare providers analyze medical images, such as X-rays and MRI scans, more accurately and efficiently, leading to earlier and more accurate diagnoses.2.	Personalized Treatment Plans: By analyzing patient data, AI and ML algorithms can help healthcare providers develop personalized treatment plans considering the patient's unique medical history, genetic makeup, and other factors.3.	Enhanced Patient Monitoring: AI and ML can be used to analyze data from wearable devices and remote monitoring systems, enabling healthcare providers to track patients' health in real time and intervene when necessary.4.	Predictive Analytics: By analyzing historical patient data, AI and ML can help healthcare providers predict patient outcomes, such as the likelihood of readmission or the progression of a disease, allowing them to take proactive measures to improve patient care.5.	Drug Discovery and Development: AI and ML can help accelerate the drug discovery process by analyzing large datasets to identify potential drug candidates and predict their effectiveness and safety.AI and machine learning solutions have the potential to revolutionize healthcare by transforming the way providers diagnose and treat various conditions. By embracing the potential of these technologies, healthcare organizations can create a more patient-centric healthcare system that prioritizes patient engagement and overall satisfaction. The future of healthcare will likely see an increased focus on AI and ML, as they continue to drive innovation and enhance patient outcomes. #AI #MachineLearning #Healthcare

Business Intelligence and Analytics in Healthcare: Driving Informed DecisionsThe healthcare industry generates massive amounts of data every day. Harnessing the power of this data through business intelligence (BI) and analytics can help healthcare providers make informed decisions and improve patient care. In this article, we will uncover the potential of BI and analytics in healthcare, exploring how these tools can enable providers to make data-driven decisions and enhance patient outcomes. Business intelligence and analytics in healthcare involve data collection, analysis, and visualization to inform decision-making processes and optimize patient care. By using BI and analytics tools, healthcare providers can gain insights into various aspects of their operations, such as patient outcomes, resource allocation, and cost management.Benefits of Business Intelligence and Analytics in Healthcare1.	Improved Patient Outcomes: BI and analytics can help healthcare providers identify patterns and trends in patient data, allowing them to make more informed treatment decisions and improve patient outcomes.2.	Enhanced Operational Efficiency: By analyzing data related to resource allocation, staff productivity, and patient flow, healthcare providers can identify areas for improvement and implement strategies to enhance operational efficiency.3.	Cost Management: BI and analytics tools can help healthcare providers analyze cost data and identify opportunities to reduce expenses and improve financial performance.4.	Data-Driven Decision Making: With access to real-time data and insights, healthcare providers can make informed decisions that are backed by evidence, leading to better patient care and overall performance.5.	Population Health Management: By analyzing large datasets, healthcare providers can gain insights into population health trends and develop targeted strategies to address specific community health issues.As BI and analytics technologies continue to advance, we can expect to see even more innovative features and solutions. Integrating artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML), technologies could further enhance data analysis and provide real-time insights to inform decision-making.Business intelligence and analytics have the potential to transform the healthcare industry by enabling providers to make data-driven decisions and improve patient care. By embracing the potential of these tools, healthcare organizations can create a more patient-centric healthcare system that prioritizes patient engagement and overall satisfaction. The future of healthcare will likely see an increased focus on BI and analytics as they continue to drive informed decision-making and enhance patient outcomes. #BI #Analytics #Healthcare

Chronic Disease Management Software: A New Era of Patient-Centric CareChronic diseases, such as diabetes, heart disease, and cancer, are among the leading causes of disability and death worldwide. Managing these conditions effectively requires ongoing patient engagement and collaboration between patients and healthcare providers. Chronic disease management software has emerged as a powerful tool to help patients and providers monitor, manage, and improve outcomes for various conditions. This article will explore the benefits of chronic disease management software and discuss its role in ushering in a new era of patient-centric care.Chronic disease management software is designed to help patients and healthcare providers track and manage various aspects of chronic conditions, such as symptoms, medications, and treatment plans. These digital tools can be integrated into existing healthcare systems or used as standalone applications, providing patients with personalized support and guidance to manage their conditions effectively.Benefits of Chronic Disease Management Software1.	Improved Health Outcomes: By providing patients with tools to monitor their symptoms, track their medications, and set health goals, chronic disease management software can help them adhere to their treatment plans and achieve better health outcomes.2.	Enhanced Patient Engagement: Chronic disease management software can facilitate better patient engagement by offering interactive tools and educational resources that help patients participate more actively in their healthcare. This can lead to increased treatment adherence and improved overall health.3. Hospital Asset Tracking Software: Maximizing Resources and Reducing CostsIn a fast-paced healthcare environment, efficient management of resources is essential for delivering high-quality patient care. Virtual Medicine: Breaking Barriers with Telemedicine SoftwareThe evolution of technology has had a significant impact on various industries, and healthcare is no exception. Accessibility: Telemedicine software enables healthcare providers to offer services to patients with limited access to healthcare facilities due to geographical, physical, or socio-economic constraints. The Importance of CMS Compliance and HIPAA Compliance in Healthcare.CMS (Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services) compliance and HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) compliance are essential components of the healthcare industry, ensuring that patient data is handled securely and in compliance with regulatory requirements. These compliance standards help protect the privacy and security of patient information, reduce the risk of data breaches, and ensure that healthcare organizations deliver high-quality care to their patients.One key benefit of CMS compliance and HIPAA compliance is improved patient trust. Patients trust healthcare providers to protect their personal and health information, and compliance with these standards can help build and maintain that trust. This can lead to better patient outcomes, improved patient satisfaction, and increased patient loyalty.Another benefit of CMS compliance and HIPAA compliance is reduced risk of penalties and legal consequences. Failure to comply with these standards can result in significant penalties and legal consequences, including fines, legal fees, and damage to the organization's reputation. Compliance with these standards can help healthcare organizations avoid these risks and ensure that they are delivering high-quality care to their patients.CMS compliance and HIPAA compliance also help improve the quality of care by ensuring that healthcare providers have access to the patient data they need to deliver effective treatment. This can lead to more informed decision-making and better patient outcomes.In addition, CMS compliance and HIPAA compliance can help healthcare organizations improve their efficiency by streamlining administrative processes and reducing the workload of administrative staff. This can enable healthcare providers to focus on more critical tasks such as patient care, improving the overall quality of care delivered to patients.Finally, CMS compliance and HIPAA compliance can help drive innovation in healthcare. By complying with these standards, healthcare organizations can create a collaborative environment that enables the development of new tools and applications that improve patient outcomes and drive the evolution of healthcare.In summary, CMS compliance and HIPAA compliance are essential components of the healthcare industry, ensuring that patient data is handled securely and in compliance with regulatory requirements. Compliance with these standards can help healthcare organizations build patient trust, reduce the risk of penalties and legal consequences, improve the quality of care, and drive innovation in healthcare.

Navigating Cloud Migration and Management in Healthcare.Cloud migration and management is transforming the healthcare industry by providing healthcare organizations with more efficient and effective ways to store, manage, and access patient data. While there are many benefits to cloud migration and management, there are also unique challenges and considerations that healthcare organizations must navigate to ensure a successful transition.One key benefit of cloud migration and management is improved scalability and flexibility. Cloud storage solutions enable healthcare organizations to store large amounts of data securely and cost-effectively, and can be easily scaled up or down as needed. This can help healthcare organizations manage the growing volume of patient data and enable more efficient use of resources.Another benefit of cloud migration and management is improved accessibility. Cloud solutions enable healthcare providers to access patient data from anywhere, at any time, using any device. This can help improve care coordination and enable more efficient communication between healthcare providers and patients.Cloud migration and management can also help healthcare organizations reduce costs by reducing the need for on-premises hardware and IT support. This can help free up resources for other critical healthcare tasks, such as patient care.However, healthcare organizations must also navigate several challenges when migrating to the cloud, including compliance with regulatory requirements such as HIPAA compliance, ensuring data security, and managing costs associated with cloud services. It is critical for healthcare organizations to partner with experienced cloud service providers who can help them navigate these challenges and ensure a successful transition to the cloud.In summary, cloud migration and management is transforming healthcare by providing healthcare organizations with more efficient and effective ways to store, manage, and access patient data. While there are unique challenges and considerations associated with cloud migration and management, partnering with experienced cloud service providers can help healthcare organizations navigate these challenges and ensure a successful transition to the cloud.

Health Plans System Extensions: Improving Patient Access to Quality Care.Health plan system extensions are transforming the healthcare industry by providing patients with improved access to high-quality healthcare services. These extensions bring together healthcare providers, payers, and patients to create a more coordinated and efficient healthcare experience that enables better communication, collaboration, and coordination.One key benefit of health plan system extensions is improved patient access to care. Patients can use these systems to access their health information, view their treatment plans, and communicate with their providers. This can lead to more informed decision making and improved patient outcomes.Another benefit of health plan system extensions is improved care coordination. Healthcare providers can use these systems to communicate with each other, share patient information, and coordinate care more effectively. This can lead to better patient outcomes and improved patient satisfaction.Health plan system extensions can also help healthcare organizations reduce costs by streamlining administrative processes and reducing the need for redundant tests and procedures. This can help reduce overall healthcare costs and improve efficiency.Health plan system extensions also help improve the quality of care by enabling providers to have a more comprehensive view of a patient's health history and treatment plan. This can lead to more informed decision making and better patient outcomes.Finally, health plan system extensions can help drive innovation in healthcare. By bringing together healthcare providers, payers, and patients, these systems can create a collaborative environment that enables the development of new tools and applications that improve patient outcomes and drive the evolution of healthcare.In summary, health plan system extensions are transforming healthcare by providing patients with improved access to high-quality healthcare services. As healthcare continues to evolve, health plan system extensions will become increasingly important for healthcare organizations to provide the best possible care to their patients.

The Importance of Medical Billing and Coding Systems in Healthcare.Medical billing and coding systems are an essential component of the healthcare industry, enabling healthcare providers to receive timely and accurate reimbursement for services provided to patients. These systems help ensure that healthcare providers are paid correctly for the services they provide, and that patients receive the appropriate care they need.One key benefit of medical billing and coding systems is improved accuracy and efficiency. These systems can help ensure that medical claims are processed accurately and efficiently, reducing the risk of errors and delays in payment. This can help healthcare providers receive timely reimbursement for the services they provide, and enable them to focus on delivering high-quality care to their patients.Another benefit of medical billing and coding systems is improved revenue cycle management. By streamlining the billing and coding process, healthcare providers can reduce the time and resources required to manage the revenue cycle, enabling them to focus on more critical tasks such as patient care.Medical billing and coding systems also help improve compliance with regulatory requirements such as CMS compliance and HIPAA compliance. These systems can help ensure that healthcare providers are compliant with these requirements, avoiding penalties and other potential legal consequences.In addition, medical billing and coding systems can help improve patient satisfaction by ensuring that patients receive timely and accurate billing statements, and by providing them with a clear understanding of their healthcare costs and insurance coverage.Finally, medical billing and coding systems can help healthcare providers identify areas for improvement in their billing and coding processes, enabling them to optimize their revenue cycle management and improve their overall financial performance.In summary, medical billing and coding systems are an essential component of the healthcare industry, enabling healthcare providers to receive timely and accurate reimbursement for services provided to patients, and helping to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements. As healthcare continues to evolve, medical billing and coding systems will become increasingly important for healthcare providers to manage their revenue cycle effectively and deliver high-quality care to their patients.

The potential influence of #chatGPT on our future goes in as many directions as there are industries it can support and/or impact.From the point of a view of a business (co-)owner you don‚Äôt want to fail to adapt. Remember traditional newspapers? The advent of the Internet had them facing a brand new reality. Readers started demanding instant access to news without having to leave theirs houses. Some of the periodicals adapted, created online editions and found out that not only are their readers happier, but also they got access to a much wider audience at a fraction of the cost. Many of the newspapers that believed that Internet would not take over our lives (and wouldn‚Äôt change their reality) lost to more agile companies, which decided to go with the change.The same goes for #chatGPT. It makes accessing information faster and more intuitive than ever before. Many factors indicate that this will be a successful endeavour that will soon become our main mean of ‚Äúcommunication‚Äù with the Internet leaving search engines as we know them as a relict from the past. We can already see this happening with Bing, with people switching over from Google, who would have thought that would be ever possible just a year ago!And this is just one example! Even though we‚Äôve always done things a certain way, we shouldn‚Äôt settle for something less efficient, out-dated and potentially at the end of its golden era. If Chat GPT allows companies to increase efficiency, decrease the workload and balance #valueformoney - go for it! Once all legal matters are settled and it reaches its full potential? Yes, please! Why stop yourself for the sake of sticking to what‚Äôs well-known?Even though it‚Äôs a game changer it may also change the rules of the game we play. As the adoption of the internet spread, so did fake news, conspiracy theories and pseudojournalism. Many examples have shown that large language models make mistakes, and often it is hard to spot if you don‚Äôt have prior knowledge. It is still an unknown how missinformation will be handled and who will be making the calls on what is considered fake news. It will surely bring a massive cultural change and shape the world as we know it üë®‚Äçüíª The world is changing, search is changing and so will our behaviour‚Ä¶ with time. It may seem disruptive, but the only constant in our lives is that everything changes. Why not embrace it wisely? üåø #chatgptai #business #ai #artificialintelligence #bing

After spending years together traveling, spending even a month without family is tough.I was happy at first - even more time to hustle on weekends, less 'distraction'.But there's also a feeling, that you're missing the chance to be out there for them, to be the father figure, being less happy & therefore less productive even.Connecting meaningfully with young kids over a short video call is the skill i'd like to have, to know how to spark a conversation.Made me wonder if I need to schedule a "meeting hour" specifically and come up with an agenda, to keep them engaged. Wouldnt that be strange and too business-like? Like "hey' son, here's my calendly link!"I know a guy (who's divorced by the way and has 2 kids he doesn't see often) who's building an app with coaching stories, that lets parents who are away, have meaningful conversations with their kids, based on the stories of their own childhood. Could use an app like that now, for sure.So, here's my question to you all: How do you cope with this situation? Any advice or tips you could share?#familyfirst #PowerOfConnection #RemoteWorkBalance

If someone took AI-generated results and tried to improve them - would that be considered *his* artwork?Did that with an artist i know, and here are the thoughts so far on the tool:- Terrific work with tone, color and texture. Honestly, I was amazed. Very high level. Conveying the mood with color.- Gives excellent silhouettes of inanimate objects.- It's  worse with live subjects. While portraits are still acceptable, the figures are still on the weak side. AI has no understanding of forces, rhythms, or anatomy after all.- The neural network has its own recognizable style. And it shone through regardless of what we were trying to to get. The result  leans toward "gritty" "dirty" and high-contrast. Maybe its just the learning curve though.- Seems like Midjourney works best with realism and scenery. So its harder to get a line art or comic style from it.-----That's what the artist himself told me after the experiment:"I really enjoyed working with the tool. It's fast and fun. But don't be fooled. It's not designed to help artists and designers. It's designed to replace them. And I think, with this development, it will succeed within the next 5 years. But you have to remember that the word Artist comes from the word Art. Nobody is surprised by a beautiful picture anymore. Anyone can do it for 10 bucks, so It's time for pictures to find stories and meanings again.  And maybe it's time for tech artists to explore new directions. "P.S. Thank to Chris Do for inspiration to try #Midjourney over Dall*e2. Both tools are amazing, and yet feel very different.#ai¬†#art¬†#creativity¬†#digital¬†#midjourneyai

Yay! Finished my extended 7-day fasting.Turned out a simple way to change my eating habits was to STOP EATING for a week. 5 Main takeaways:1. Didn't feel hungry at all during that time. Had a lot of urges to eat though, especially in the evening.2. Noticed that *all* of my food cravings were triggered by pure psychological reasons: stress, boredom, tiredness, habit.3. Noticing & resisting those cravings in my mind felt like a very interesting psychological exercise in itself: mental aikido of sorts.4. The physical feeling of lack of certain minerals/electrolytes was also interesting. (I knew what I lacked because of medical tests I took prior to the fast.)5. The overall feeling of "newness" and "self reboot" has been probably the most important thing. Like you're starting a brand-new chapter in life.---Would repeat it sometime again. Pls bear in mind a lot of research went into this (Dr. Jason Fung especially recommended, cannot recommend his books/YouTube channel more).Would also like to thank Joseph Mocanu: his two similar fasts helped me understand what to expect, Jack Rudenko for his fasting advice and 14-day fasting experiment, and Chris Kehayias - for sharing his Keto ways.Either way, it feels like just the beginning of a new personal journey.Best of luck to everyone trying to change something in their lives!P.S. Result: ~ 4.5 kg (yeah, mostly water, I know).  More importantly: feeling great.  Now *any* food is a wonder of taste and nutritiousness, so it's really simple to choose the healthy option!#fasting #habits #keto

Attention is based on emotions.--In an office cafe today, a barista added a pen to her hairstyle.Seemed a bit prehistoric - like the Flintstones character.This was enough for everyone coming in to smile and start a conversation. It seemed that they were thrown out of the thoughts of the working day and were a little happier and more relaxed than usual.Just a little weird detail gave an excuse for people to feel.Is it is necessary to be as eccentric as possible? - not at all.Even a difficult-to-understand scientific article or a professional post can emotionally hook the right reader  _resonate_  in a wordAfter all, emotion is not only what you put in forcefully, but a reaction in the eyes of the beholder. You need to know the audience inside out, though, to know what would work.This is the kind of mistake I see daily in the tech world - people focus on function, on the offer, on unique positioning even. Without emotion, your message would not go through!Yes, the value of your product is primary, but marketing without creating emotions first, a cold, calculating offer is just another piece of information noise. As noisy as my office center in the middle of the working day.Does your product evoke emotions in people?Would it be strong enough so that it becomes part of the story of their day?#marketing #emotion #branding #technology #startup

Sir¬†Clive¬†Sinclair, creator of ZX Spectrum passed away aged 81.Feeling so much gratitude for what this man did.I played on Speccy since I was 7 or 8. And oh, what kind of games they were - deep, complex,  inventive, challenging, demanding. As different from console titles of the era, as hypercasual mobile ones are different from the Microsoft Flight Simulator right now.Those 3.5 MHz of awesomeness helped me learn English, logic, spark my interest in computers and so much more. I remember sleepless nights of creating pixel-art interfaces in "Artist II" for imaginary games I invented in my head (I didn't try to program much, I went directly to creating "screenshots".) - it's not surprising that I got into UI / UX laterBecause of his work, thousands of kids learned to dream, code, draw in front of their own personal computer. Working with and around it's limitations.Especially in Russia in the 90ies when PCs were a luxury - that raised a whole generation of people filled with curiosity and ingenuity, including me.Thanks a lot, Sir.#ZXSpectrum¬†#innnovation #technology

Elon Musk's 5-step process to avoid design & manufacturing mistakes, which, from my experience is super relevant to digital product design as well!Thanks to Michael Jackson for the original post and video.These are *so* much in line with the mistakes I've constantly seen (and did,heh) in digital product design, so sharing it with you.Enjoy:1. Everyone's wrong (in regard to requirements)A lot of requirements and ideas are based on wrong assumptions and outdated concepts. Once we were creating an optimization system for a corporation,¬†where the top management had a *completely* different understanding of their work processes "in the fields", than it turned out to be in reality, which we only learnt through behind-the-scenes conversations on the ground.2. Cut out parts of the processA client once said very true words to me -¬†"Let's not turn the process into an academic exercise". In some projects, we could have cut half of the functionality we did, and it would still work perfectly well without any effect on the revenue.People tend to add, not subtract (a famous cognitive trap). And subtracting is the most overlooked part in decision making.3. Simplify and optimize existing featuresDon't optimize what should not exist in the first place!People tend to constantly reinvent the wheel, when there are already simple solutions out there. (cognitive need for innovation, huh)For example, in UI/UX -¬†there are TONS of free amazing design systems or UI Kits. But I know people who tried to start development by creating their own kits, duh4. Accelerate cycle timeGo faster. There are always ways to use 80/20 principle and focus on the 20% of the job, that brings most of the result. A vivid example is an implemented design sprint, when complex decisions are made, carried out and tested within one week.¬†Previously it could have taken a month to do so.5. AutomateOnce the process is proven to give results - it should be recorded, decomposed into parts and automated where possible (usually using API's integrations and various tools, Zapier being a prime example).Did you do these mistakes like Elon (and me :)) which of them has brought the most grief? Just 4 traits unite the best founders I've worked with.And they turned out to be very similar to what YC recommends when looking for a ‚Äúco-founder‚Äù.¬†1. The ability to communicate effectively is the most important skill of founders and is rarely discussed.¬†¬†Tech startups must have at least one founder who creates a product or service and at least one founder who knows (or can learn) how to sell and communicate with users. It can be the same person. Founders who are difficult to communicate with are almost always ineffective.Their secret?Linking the most effective and life-changing method of tackling conflict, which those people use (sometimes unconsciously)¬†2. Working with the most successful founders does not put you under a lot of stress because you feel that ‚Äúsuch a founder will get the job done, no matter what.‚Äù Sometimes one can succeed solely through willpower.¬†3. Excellent founders have a number of seemingly contradictory character traits. One example is having rigidity and flexibility at the same time. Founders need to have a solid understanding of the essence of the company and its mission, and at the same time be flexible enough and ready to accept new realities when it comes to almost all other things.¬†4. The best founders are extremely responsive. This is an indicator of determination, purposefulness, energy, and the ability to achieve the set goals.Would you add any more traits to this list? What would those be?#leadership #founders #tech #startups

Lungpass is a smart stethoscope paired with an app, which helps monitor patients with pulmonary diseases and detects respiratory abnormalities. It gives you the ability to take care of your children and family members‚Äô health, assess their current condition, and determine when a doctor‚Äôs consultation is needed.The company trusted us with redesigning the app - originally it was created according to outdated guidelines and the functionality was incomprehensible to users. Our main goal was to analyze the difficulties which users might face while using the app, change the workflow and make it user-friendly.In a few months we completely redesigned the existing app:- created the training mode to ensure the easy onboarding;- developed a dynamic, interesting questionnaire, which would be understandable for everyone questionnaire;- made the app user-friendly: re-wrote the doctors‚Äôs advices, replaced the pictures of trained muscled bodies on the screens with a realistic version;- redesigned the app and built the functionality based on customers feedback.As a result, the customers‚Äô engagement rate was increased thanks to the app‚Äôs new functionality, which fits the customers‚Äô needs and overcomes possible difficulties in using a high-tech device.Helena Binetskaya, the CEO of Lungpass, shared her experience of working with us: ‚ÄúA fair number of teams can come up with beautiful layouts. Where Alexander‚Äôs team stands out, is that they go far beyond design per se (awesome as it is) and deliver a product that serves business purposes brilliantly‚Äù.#casestudy #startupcommunity #appdesign #uiux #userexperience #mobileappdesign #health #tech

When do I need to rebrand?¬†Before jumping into any significant changes, ask yourself these questions:¬†Audience & Needs:- Do I know my target audience, its needs and challenges?- Does my brand attract the right audience?Image & Message:- Is the online image of my company on-brand?- Does the brand‚Äôs image deliver a clear message to my customers?- Does the company‚Äôs image strikes as professional or amateur?Emotion & Values:- How does the target audience resonate with my brand?- Is there a gap between what your customers think about your company and what you'd want them to think?¬†If you don‚Äôt quite like the answers to these questions or find yourself wondering what those might be, it is a solid reason that you need to think about reimagining and rebranding your company.How to do that?I'd be happy to share the framework I use & learn about your branding challenges - just let me know in DM or comments.#digitalmarketing #branding #startup

Why does feature creep happen?Why do developers tend to over-engineer?Why are interfaces convoluted?Same reason - human psychology and cognitive bias."People are far more likely to consider solutions that add features than solutions that remove them."It's like with kids and ice-cream, like my colleague told me, they always think "more flavors are better"SoLooking to be more creativ–µ and find solutions that others systematically overlook? - think on what you can _subtract._P.S> Linking a great article about it from "Nature" journal in the comments.#innovation #startup #uiux #uidesign #tech

Those pics are _13 years old_.Still so relevant! Why?Why do so many relatively successful SaaS's and startups still look and feel like that?- Project was built using basic UI Kits by programmers (that's what i actually approve of.. if you're doing an MVP)- Functionality over UX (let's add a new function and slap it right there)- Little to no UX research (i tested it on my cat, she found it good enough) - No idea what a "design system" is, and how having a distinct design language retains users, making them happierA lot of products were built  in an evolutionary way, with no regard to proper user research.Who are our users? What they need right now? What do they *feel* every step of the way. Do they feel like you *care*?Yes, UI/UX is not just about "simplest way to find a function", its about caring how your customer feels every step of the way.#userexperience #ui #saas #uidesign #startupsP.S> Original pics by Eric Burke 2008..

‚ÄúRemember - no branding!‚Äù----Almost no one in tech/startup owners chats and communities talks about branding. Why?I've been a participant in several active startup & tech owners chats and communities for several years and most conversations revolve around funding, legal issues - usual stuff. Typical opinions:- Branding is luxury in the tech world where "good enough" and "fast" is the mantra. - "Don't waste time on brand" Talk to customers. Listen. Refine product.- Focus on actual client acquisition, not "awareness"These words have their merit. The one where you talk to customers - especially.But, oh do they miss out on something.Branding is NOT ‚Äúpouring money into flashy stuff and empty words‚Äù.It's -taking the effort to realize what makes your company really stand out, making sure it has a distinct and charismatic personality that your customers ‚Äúdig‚Äù, making it easy for them to deeply align with.-working on brand experience, understanding what makes it unique above the pure transactional value-discovering, promising and fulfilling your audience wishes, using customer success and resulting trust as part of your storyResult -> communication becomes so much more clear & you end up building relationships, not transactions.

One of the things I believe is wrong in the corporate/creative world is taking away the ownership of your work.C'mon - world is built on contractors, and there's nothing to be ashamed of, when hiring external help for development or design.I work with people who are obsessed with their craft, and not allowing them to share what they've done to the world, as their "child".. is borderline slavery and is plain evil.One of my clients was highly surprised to see all contractors (with their faces and contact info) i've worked with in the resulting presentation. Showing kudos and gratitude to people you work with and letting them be own their work - is highly humanizing all interaction and makes everyone happier and more motivated in the process.Having said that, i've just gained permission to put some of the work we've done 3+ years ago for Renault, Volkswagen, Unilever.. and sadly didn't get that permission for some other Fortune500 brands in automobile and tech industry, which made me write this. Really. Don't be evil.I believe everyone has a right to own their work & take pride in it.Do you agree?Have you ever had your work "taken" from you?P.S. If you disagree, I bet you're a lawyer! :)#design #mobile #digitaldesign #creativedesign #creative #creativebusiness

Bill Gates on the AI revolution in education and new era of the "personal agent": Bill Gates believes no single company will dominate the field of AI. However, he sees a significant opportunity for a company to develop a personal agent capable of understanding users' activities and reading their messages. This agent would serve as a mediator for various tasks, potentially eliminating the need for search sites, productivity tools, and even online marketplaces like Amazon. As for the Education industry, lifelike and infinitely patient online tutoring is one place Gates sees tremendous growth. Motivation problems are very common in education, so one-on-one tutoring can be highly effective in addressing this issue. And if we can capture the expertise of the best tutors in a software agent, it'll change education in a very deep way.#edtech #education #elearning #ai

Detailed perspective on the key trends and characteristics that make successful B2C EdTech startups stand out. Here are my takeaways: In the pre-school sector, there is a shift towards high-quality educational content that incorporates physical materials like books, puzzles, and toys. Personalized learning and gamification are also gaining popularity in this space.For K-12 and Higher Education, virtual peer-to-peer support and EdTech-focused versions of platforms like TikTok are emerging as new trends. These platforms allow students to learn together in virtual spaces and integrate social components into the learning experience.In lifelong learning, content curation platforms and cohort-based programs are on the rise. Content aggregators help learners filter and prioritize information, while cohort-based programs provide real-world applications and a sense of social pressure for continuous learning.To succeed in B2C EdTech, consider these three success dimensions:1. Content: Provide high-quality and diverse educational content in a user-friendly format. Incorporate peer-to-peer learning and scalable live sessions.2. User Satisfaction: Meet the demands of different user groups, such as learners and paying customers (parents). Prioritize building a daily learning environment and incentivize content creators.3. Scalability: Focus on strong execution, leveraging product-led growth (PLG) and conducting extensive A/B testing. Consider metrics like customer acquisition costs, user engagement, and retention.Remember, collaboration within the founder community and understanding your audience are key to building successful B2C EdTech ventures.Explore the full article: https://lnkd.in/d88wVG_2#edtech #education #elearning #startups

Let's see what's new and why it's worth upgrading to this latest version.The latest version of OneRoster, 1.2, offers several core benefits over the previous versions¬†that make it a must-have for any content provider and school district:‚ö°Improved security: OneRoster 1.2 aligns its security architecture with the IMS Security Framework, providing better PII protection and improved safety protocols.‚ö°Enhanced rostering: OneRoster 1.2 introduces new demographic options like genders, pronouns, and preferred names for users. Additionally, users can have multiple roles across several organizations.‚ö°More fine-tuning in gradebook: OneRoster 1.2 introduces new result statuses, non-numeric score support, and score scales.By upgrading to OneRoster 1.2, you can take advantage of these new features, which can help streamline roster sharing, grading, and enrollment processes for your educational software. Check out the full article to learn more about OneRoster 1.2 and its core improvements.#edtech #compliance #schools #elearning

Why do world-famous brands go Web3?Over the last decade, brands significantly relied on social networks for their audience formation, spending vast sums of budget money on digital marketing. Sponsored social media channels turned out to be a powerful advertising campaign (billions of users open apps like Instagram or TikTok every day), which led to losing control of valuable customer data and brand blurring.This is exactly where the help of NFT (Non-Fungible Token) came in. Its underlying technology - key for exclusive access, returns power to private parties and brands, meaning they can directly interact with customers.Some famous companies are planning to enter or have already entered the Web3 space. For example, Tiffany & Co‚Äôs exclusive NFTiffs were sold out less than half an hour after they were launched. Lamborghini continues its eight-month ‚ÄúThe epic road trip‚Äù program releasing new NFTs to collect and, of course, rewarding the most loyal fans. Even Starbucks is planning to unveil its own NFTs on the 13th of September, noting they wouldn‚Äôt just serve as digital collections but would provide their owners with other privileges. Their Web3 -based loyalty program could also serve as a way of attracting younger customers to the brand. Starbucks interim CEO Howard Schultz states, ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt want to be in a business where our customer base is aging, and we have a less relevant situation with younger people.‚Äù#web3 #nft

KEEPING BALANCE IN LIFEGrowing up as a Gen Y kid, everything was hard to accomplish, life taught me that in order to succeed, I would have to educate myself and always work hard, and so I did. Decades have passed, accomplishments were made, and one realization I made was‚Ä¶ I was wrong. It is not always working hard, but keeping a balance between work and rest. My personal life is just as important.Losing ourselves to our jobs and becoming workaholics in today‚Äôs fast-paced world proved to be an ineffective method for me, and so did taking life too easily. A variety of both strategies provides a healthier, more productive life. ¬†The working world is¬†slowly changing¬†as more and more companies are beginning to welcome the idea¬†of achieving a work-life balance.¬†Establishing a work-life balance is like creating art. Working adds meaning to our life, working all the time transforms our lives into chaos. On the other hand, resting too much make our lives too dull. Balancing a combination of both is my advice to utilize potentials, an ideal solution for both the employee and the employer to benefit from. Balance is always the answer‚Ä¶ or what do you all think?¬† #Balance #Workoholics #GenY

LA is a new home for me and 20 Ukrainian founders. Being new here, I believe it is important to build the brand of Ukrainian founders in the US. Our story below is the first step to reaching that goal. This post is a story of how we did make it happen and appreciation to everyone who did contribute.On October 6, I met Dana Sydorenko üá∫üá¶ at the Crosscut Ventures Octoberfest event. She did invite me to the Ukrainian Tech Meetup Group in LA. This is how I got acquainted with the rest of the Ukrainian Founders Community in LA: Pavlo Shlapak Oleksiy Malytskyy üá∫üá¶ Oleksandr Gamaniuk Vlad Klimchuk Dmitriy Kotenok Daniel Tonkopi Alexey Menshikov üá∫üá¶ Yevheniia Zhoholieva Lev FilimonovLater on, I did invite to our community my friends in LA:Andrew Skrypnyk- we met during LA Tech Week, my first live event in LAArtem Kudymovsky - we know each other for 12 years, but reconnect recently when Artem did comment on my Linkedin article: https://lnkd.in/gt8m76VGEugene Arutyunyan - who is like me from Odesa, but we met first time here.Also in October, I did attend dot.la summit, where I met Sam N. Adams, CEO at dot.la, and did ask him if he knows that 20 Ukrainian founders choose LA as their home and if he want to feature that story. Sam says that he is interested. After 3 follow-ups I did receive a green light from him and he did introduce me to Drew Grant, editorial director. We did discuss with Drew logistics and did wait until great journalist - Aisha Counts will become available to schedule a live interview. Once the interview gets scheduled, I did outreach to the founders, to confirm those who were ready to participate and collect initial data points for Aisha to enable her to structure an interview process. The next piece of the puzzle was finding the right location for the interview. Fortunately, Dana Sydorenko üá∫üá¶ (thanks!) did outreach to Brian Mac Mahon and we get confirmed Expert Dojo as the event location. Also, I am grateful to Artem Kudymovsky and ITRex Group for sponsoring event catering.A few days before the event, I did offer to Aisha that it will be great to have an external point of view on Ukrainian founders. I did invite Brandon Gerson who is an angel investor in primeclass.io, and Dana Sydorenko üá∫üá¶ did invite Brian Mac Mahon who invested in GameTree.On January 14, we spent 4 hours together being interviewed and networking with each other. The final result of all this work you can read by clicking the link below. Would love to read your feedback and comments. Once again, thanks to everyone who make it happen!https://lnkd.in/g3M57-kc

üìä Last year, companies around the globe invested $93.5 billion in artificial intelligence projects. An honest answer will be "partially."ü§ñ AI is getting marvelous at routine tasks like taking customer service calls and monitoring equipment on the factory floor. Our company unanimously condemns Russia's war against Ukraine and calls for the restoration of peace, law, and order. We at ITRex prioritize our people's lives first, trying to do everything imaginable to ensure their safety and well-being. And because we operate in Ukraine, Belarus, and Russia, everyone is affected at the moment. I'm not sure it is a known fact that the absolute majority of IT companies' staff is liberal-minded, and they choose to stand against war and tyranny. Some of our people have already faced political repercussions for expressing their support of Ukraine and standing for democratic values. A couple of people were detained and went to jail for demonstrations. Some of the people are in fear for their lives because of the new totalitarian legislation. We made a firm decision to leave no one behind and sponsor evacuation and relocation for every employee willing to flee their home (including interns). And that's almost 90%+ of our staff and their families. The above mentioned creates tremendous costs that we have to carry as a business.Suppose you want to make a difference and help. In that case, one of the tangible ways to support Ukraine directly is to hire our talented engineers and allow them to continue applying their professional skills to do what they love. Our fellows from the entire company are already doing their best to help each other morally and financially, so any additional support will be a huge plus.If your company is open to supporting the people in need, we're asking you to consider giving our people work, even temporarily, on a subcontract basis. We have a sizable bench of software developers and QAs, whom we're trying to keep busy and funded. If you could give those people an opportunity to continue applying their skills, that would be an enormous help for our people in Ukraine. It could be a win-win as we could potentially address your sourcing needs in the interim.Please, contact hello@itrexgroup.com with the tag #SaveUkraine in the subject line.#pleaseshare #stopwarinukraine #ukrainesupport

All our people at ITRex are deeply shocked by the horrible and shameful war that Russia has waged against Ukraine. Innocent people are killed, hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians are forced to flee their country in fear of their life, and crowded cities are being bombarded. This is an unspeakable tragedy. Apple's foray into the financial services ecosystem in 2014 was a remarkable strategic move. By leveraging its vast user base, seamless hardware-software integration, and exclusive control over its ecosystem, Apple has positioned itself as a formidable player in the finance industry.Their ability to offer a diverse range of financial services without being a bank is a testament to their innovative approach. It's evident that their focus on customer experience and partnerships with established financial institutions and FinTechs have paid off.Apple's dominance in the mobile space gives them a unique advantage, allowing them to shape the future of finance through their ecosystem. This poses challenges for incumbent banks, as replicating such a digital wallet and global reach is a daunting task.As Apple continues to expand its financial services offerings, it will undoubtedly further disrupt the traditional banking landscape. Banks and other financial players must adapt to this changing landscape and find ways to collaborate or differentiate themselves to stay competitive.Overall, Apple's approach to finance showcases its commitment to enhancing customer experiences and leveraging its ecosystem's potential. As we entered a new 2023 year, it's important to stay informed about the latest trends in the ever-evolving field of IT. Keeping up with these trends can help you stay ahead of the curve and stay competitive in your industry. Here are five trends in IT that you should keep an eye on in 2023:1. Edge computing: With the increasing amount of data being generated and the need for real-time processing, edge computing is becoming an important trend. Edge computing involves processing data at the edge of the network, closer to the source of the data, rather than sending it to a central location for processing. This can help reduce latency and improve performance. 2. Artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML): AI and ML are being used more and more in various industries, from healthcare to finance. As these technologies continue to improve, we can expect to see more applications of AI and ML in the coming year. 3. 5G networks: With the deployment of 5G networks, we can expect to see faster internet speeds and more reliable connections. This will open up new possibilities for things like the Internet of Things (IoT) and autonomous vehicles. 4. Cybersecurity: With the increasing amount of data being stored and shared digitally, cybersecurity is becoming more important than ever. In 2023, we can expect to see more focus on securing data and devices, as well as the development of new technologies to help prevent cyber attacks. 5. Cloud computing: Cloud computing has been a trend for a few years now, but it's not slowing down. The use of cloud computing will continue to grow in 2023, as more companies move their data and applications to the cloud for increased flexibility and scalability.By keeping an eye on these trends, you can stay ahead of the curve and be prepared for what the future holds in the IT industry.#ITTrends2023 #EdgeComputing #AI #ML #5G #Cybersecurity #CloudComputing

Generating emails, meeting agendas, or reports are some of the common use cases for ChatGPT. But providing the necessary details to generate those texts result in putting sensitive company information at risk.In fact, an analysis conducted by security firm Cyberhaven found that of 1.6 million knowledge workers across industries,¬†5.6% had tried ChatGPT at least once at work, and 2.3% had put confidential company data into ChatGPT.Companies like JP Morgan, Verizon, Accenture and Amazon¬†have banned staff from using ChatGPT at work over security concerns. And just recently,¬†Italy decided to ban ChatGPT while investigating privacy concerns, drawing attention from privacy regulators in other European countries.#security #chatgpt #data #privacy
